 Job Description
 Mid-level Environmental Scientist/Engineer – Tulsa, OK 
 
 
 As an industry leader, Trihydro provides U.S. engineering and environmental services dedicated to providing clients across many industries with effective, responsive, and safe solutions. Our company offers you a safe, professional, and positive working environment as we tackle some of the most complex environmental challenges. 
 Responsibilities 
 In your role as an Environmental Scientist duties will include soil and groundwater quality assessment and environmental sampling, operations and maintenance support for remediation systems, data review, and assisting with technical report preparation. Applicants must have excellent technical writing skills, a clean driving record, and a demonstrated commitment to safe operations. This position will require field work, such as supervising subcontractors and sample collection, and some travel (up to 50% of work time may include travel). 
 Location 
 The preferred candidate will be based in Tulsa, OK. 
 Required Qualifications: 
 5-10 years of relevant experience 
 A Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree (MS preferred) in Environmental Science, Geology, Biology, Engineering, or a related field 
 Exceptional written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with clients and project team members 
 Good employment or academic history with a commitment to safe work practices 
 Initiative and motivation, with an emphasis on completing project deliverables on schedule 
 Reliable, team-oriented work habits 
 Ability to travel to client sites and other Trihydro offices 
 A clean driving record 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 Strong technical and problem-solving skills, including attention to detail and accuracy, as well as a commitment to producing high-quality deliverables 
 Strong mechanical aptitude 
 Direct industry employment history in environmental compliance, within an industrial setting, or a related field 
 Experience with and an interest in contributing to site assessment, subsurface investigations, evaluating fate and transport of contaminants, development of site conceptual models, and evaluation of remedial alternatives 
 Benefits 
 At Trihydro, our approach to work is honest and hard-working. You’ll find a company culture that is dedicated to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun – often outdoors! Some of the benefits of joining our team include: 
 Robust health insurance (medical, dental, vision, and prescription) 
 Industry-leading 401(k) retirement plan, including a discretionary match up to 10% by Trihydro 
 Comprehensive paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, and holiday pay 
 Wellness program, including reimbursement for gym membership or related expenses 
 Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional/career advancement 
 Best-in-class safety culture built to protect our employees – the mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters who deserve to go home safely each night

Sr. Project Engineer - TanksReplacing Tim Fox
 TEAM Tank Consultants provides inspection and related engineering services for the above ground storage tank (AST) industry. The company’s staff of API (American Petroleum Institute) certified field inspectors and engineers provide the backbone of those services.
 This position provides technical and engineering support for the Tank Inspection Services business unit of the company. The senior level of this position description is achieved through experience; time and grade; a high level of achievement in the performance of the duties and responsibilities described herein; and with the review and approval of senior company management.
 Duties and Responsibilities:
 1. Perform engineering evaluations of tank inspections and prepare professional evaluation reports based on those inspections. This will include the interpretation of field collected physical data and tank conditions, digital photographs, industry standards and best practices, special customer requirements, the use of technical software tools and applications, personal work experience and sound engineering judgment. Process reports and evaluations in a timely and efficient manner and submit for peer/supervisory review according to policy and procedure. Implement evaluation report changes and corrections as directed.
 2. As requested and required, travel to and from customer facilities and perform field tank inspection work. At all times, perform work mindful of the health and safety of self and others. Prepare field inspection reports and forms according to standards, policies and procedures and collect numerical data using several technical measurement devices and instruments including laser levels, floor scanners, ultrasonic thickness gauges, survey equipment, and other NDT equipment.
 3. Check, proof-read and edit engineering evaluation reports prepared by a staff of Technical Report Writers or others mindful of communicating the report in a consistent style, language and with the field inspector’s intended meaning. As necessary, contact field inspectors to resolve field report questions and ambiguities.
 4. Answer customer tank inspection related incoming phone calls, communicate tank inspection results and answer customer questions representing the company in a professional manner. Answer field inspector and customer questions about API standards including but not limited to API-650 and API-653. Answer technical questions from the technical report writers (TRW’s) about field inspectors’ notes, short hand notations, acronyms, etc. using the opportunity to teach, train and pass-on storage tank knowledge.
 5. Prepare and process documentation for third party engineering services provided by the company including Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and Fitness for Service (FFS) evaluations and coordinate the work of such entities mindful of customer requirements and schedules.
 6. On occasion, as part of training and dependent on staffing levels perform the work duties normally provided by other engineering staff. Those duties may include field inspection report data entry, preparation of CAD drawings, etc.
 7. Maintain and improve knowledge of the tank inspection industry through trade magazines, newsletters and publications. As approved and directed, attend industry conferences and other meetings with existing and potential customers and represent the company at such events.
 8. Prepare for and re-certify as an API Inspector on an ongoing basis. Assist field inspectors and other staff in the preparation for re-certification.
 9. Be informed, follow and comply with all company policies and procedures.
 10. Accept and perform miscellaneous engineering job-related duties and projects as assigned. 
 Minimum Requirements:
 1. Bachelor's of Science degree preferably in Mechanical or Civil Engineering. Other technical or engineering degrees in a related field of discipline would be considered.
 2. 5 to 10 years of above ground storage tank industry is expected. Experience in suitable structural fields could be considered.
 3.As a condition of employment and within the first year of employment, it will be expected that the incumbent study for and prepare to take and pass the API-653 Certified Tank Inspector test. The majority of time spent in study and preparation to be performed outside of normal work. The company does pay the associated test fees, first sitting only, and for a one-week comprehensive class on the subject matter immediately prior to the test.
 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
 1. The ability, attitude, personality and respect for others to work equally well in team situations with a diverse background of co-workers as well as individual work situations performed without direct supervision and entirely self motivated.
 2. A good working knowledge of the fundamentals of mathematics and engineering as obtained through formal engineering course curriculum.
 3. Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills. The ability to analyze complex engineering problems with multiple inputs, conduct research, develop and test solutions and document work product.
 4. Advanced technical writing skills, vocabulary and the ability to communicate technical concepts in simple language.
 5. A comprehensive working knowledge of desktop computer operating systems and basic fundamentals of computer networking
 6. A comprehensive working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. The ability to develop Excel spreadsheet solutions with easy to understand user inputs and interface, the appropriate use of formulas and presentation of results.
 7. A working knowledge of the Internet as a resource and research tool
 8. Good typing and numerical data entry skills.
 9. Ability to develop, interpret, adapt, and apply guidelines and procedures.
 Working Conditions and Physical Effort:
 1. During the initial training period, 6 months to 1 year, a significant portion of time worked may involve travel to customer facilities and the physical rigors and hazards of performing above ground storage tank inspection work. This is outdoor work with exposure to hot and cold climates and working conditions in and around above ground storage tanks.
 2. Beyond the initial training period, there is an expectation that the incumbent may be asked and required to perform such work described above on an occasional and ongoing basis dependent on the workloads and staffing levels of the company.
 3. When not in the field, the work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment.

Job Description----THIS POSITION REQUIRES YOU TO LIVE WITHIN 50 MILES OF TULSA AREA Senior Electrical Engineer Tulsa based Pencore Engineering, LLC., is a dynamic and growing engineering and service company that provides electrical instrumentation and control systems solutions for a wide variety of major industrial customers in the Oklahoma, Kansas, Arkansas, Missouri, Louisiana and Texas regions. We perform engineering, design and management, from concept to completion for small to medium sized projects for our clients. We provided creative solutions to complex problems. Our experience, expertise and strive for excellence allows us to provide full-service engineering package for a wide clientele bas and serve various industries. As a small and flexible company, with a high-caliber staff, our business has demonstrated continued solid growth even in a tough economy. We are looking for a motivated and talented Senior Electrical Engineer to join our team and help us meet the challenging opportunities that our clients bring to us. We are looking for long-term employees, committed individuals who will attach. We are looking for long-term employees, committed individuals who will attach their reputation to ours and help drive our persistent growth. Work is varied, including in-office as well as on-site projects across the Oklahoma, Kansas, Arkansas, Missouri, Louisiana and Texas regions, minimal travel is required. Tasks and Responsibilities may include: · Develop sketches and specifications for electrical distribution systems for large industrial applications in accordance with industry standards. · System calculations and studies for electrical power systems – load flow, voltage drop, motor starting, arc flash, short circuit studies and relay coordination studies. · Provide technical expertise, mentoring and support for our other design engineers, filed service engineers, and technicians, as well as technical training for our clients. · Develop technical bid tabulations for clients to support the selection of switchgear and related electrical equipment, as well as developing bid proposals, project schedules, and manpower requirements. · Conduct technical and professional review of projects assigned to others. · Develop solutions for equipment upgrades and for life extension of existing electrical equipment. · Perform forensic analysis and troubleshooting of new or existing installations. · Oversee the development of electrical control schematics, one-lines, and some mechanical drawings for a variety of switchgear and controls applications. · Occasional travel and overnight stay typically in OK, TX, KS, AR, and MO areas. A successful Applicant should have: ·  BS in Electrical Engineering · Immediate eligibility for PE licensure in Oklahoma and neighboring states. · Knowledge of electrical power distribution and associated equipment. · Ten years’ experience in industrial power, electrical machines, controls and protection · Experience in  Project Management ,  Field Experience  and the ability to manage several projects simultaneously, from conception to completion. · Expert ability to read, correctly interpret, and apply electrical one-lines, schematics, and technical instruction manuals. · In-depth knowledge of NEC, NFPA-70E, IEEE, ANSI, and other applicable standards, regulations and guidelines. Additional desirable qualifications include: · Ability to interpret and design protective relay control schemes · Some experience performing power system studies such as Arc Flash Hazard Analysis, Short Circuit Analysis, Protective Device Coordination, Load Flow Study, Voltage Drop Analysis, Motor Starting Study using SKM, E-TAP or similar software. Additional Training may be provided. A successful career with our company will require: · Demonstrated motivation, expertise, and character that will be compatible with our highly relational marketing strategies and our close-knit team of engineers and designers. · Quality-driven customer-focused team-player mentality. · Continued eagerness to learn new skills, concepts, and tasks. · Willingness to work in a multi-task environment which demands the ability to quickly adapt to changing customer and company requirements. · A strong sense of urgency and initiative. · Ability to be a self-starter and work with minimal supervision · Commitment to follow customer and company safety policies and training. · Ability to pass  10-year background check  with initial and random drug and alcohol tests. · Ability to communicate comfortably and effectively in English, both written and orally to management, co-workers, associates and customers. Compensation and benefits, including medical, vision and dental insurance, as well as 401k plan, are  competitive  and based on qualifications, education, experience and demonstrated skills. All interested and qualified  Engineers  are encouraged to apply quickly by sending a confidential professional resume, as our need is immediate, and we would like to fill the position as soon as possible. Job Type: Full-time - TULSA, OK area Job Type: Full-time Salary: $50,000.00 to $150,000.00 /year Experience: Electrical Engineering: 5 years (Preferred) Location: Tulsa, OK 74115 (Required) Application Question: What is your expected salary range? Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insurance Dental insurance Vision insurance Retirement plan Paid time off This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail Schedule: Other Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

SCOPE OF POSITION The Lab Technician-Ultra Pure will provide analytical support through the analysis of products and system fluids that aid in controlling the quality of the end products, thereby meeting the needs of both customer and company. The incumbent will help in the detection of variances from the norm, and offer any solutions to improve deficiencies, thus helping production and quality. The Lab Technician-Ultra Pure will support and assist the Plant Manager in operating the facility in a safe and environmentally friendly manner, produce and ship on time the highest quality products at the lowest possible costs, while practicing the ethics of Responsible CARE, ISO 9001, RC 14000 and meeting all federal, state and local laws, regulations and security. In addition maintain the company culture SAFE (Safety, Accountability, Fun, Entrepreneurial) and “One” Chemtrade vision EPIC (Employee, People First, Integrity, Customer Focused). RESPONSIBILITIES Laboratory Tasks: 70%  Perform sampling and analysis of products according to the sampling and duty schedules and completion of same in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Work Instructions that affect product quality and quality control systems are followed. Ability to utilize lab instrumentation such as UV/VIS, Auto titrator, and ICP-MS. Analyze metals contaminates in a class 10 or class 1,000 cleanroom Collect Ultra-Pure sulfuric acid samples in a cleanroom. Analyze Ultra-Pure samples with an ICP-MS at PPT (Part Per Trillion) and PPQ (Part Per Quadrillion) levels. Perform troubleshooting and scheduled maintenance on ICP-MS. Perform advanced maintenance on ICP-MS to include: Replace rough pump, gas lines, lenses, cones, vacuum lines, XYZ box, interface, auto sampler, spray chamber, octopole assembly, nebulizer Assist ICP-MS service engineer during repair on instrument and preventative maintenance visits. Maintains ICP-MS maintenance logs. Act as an OWNER of the ICP-MS for analytical discussions with other facilities and customers. Ensure Quality Control protocols are adhered too. Ensure clean room protocols are followed. Follow clean room cleaning protocols. Assist other plants to troubleshoot analytical issues. E mail, phone, site visits, etc. Maintain inventory and proper usage, labeling, and storage of chemicals and supplies in the laboratory. Ensure that laboratory equipment is maintained to perform to standards and to insure that spare parts or backups are on hand to minimize downtime of instrumentation and equipment. Ensure ICP-MS critical spares inventory is current and any missing parts are ordered and replaced. Work in conjunction with management to suggest changes in the plant and laboratory to improve the quality of our products, efficiency of operation, and ability to sample and analyze with improved accuracy to meet the current requirements and expected future demands. Assist the operations by doing any special tests or analyses when requested. Work in conjunction with Management, Maintenance and Operations to monitor and maintain the pond NPDES within EPA standards and perform required testing. Send out samples of the pond discharge to an outside laboratory for testing in compliance with the site NPDES permit. As needed contact outside laboratories to schedule testing. Work as a member of a team within Chemtrade laboratories to troubleshoot potential issues and develop new advanced testing methodology. Prepare Certificates of Analysis for product shipments as required by company policy; maintain files. Ensure proper labeling and packaging for shipment of product samples according to company policies; maintain records of samples shipped out. Maintain accurate laboratory records of analytical results, quality control tests and logbooks according to plant policy. Compile, publish and file a daily report on analytical results from plant samples and customer samples. Order supplies as needed following the Chemtrade process. Compile and upload daily analytical into the SQC program Northwest Quality Analyst (NWA) Generate graphs from NWA on a weekly basis or if needed for plant troubleshooting issues as needed. Continuous Improvement: 20% Work with other team members towards the solution of problems and to fulfill the manufacturing objectives, and participate in continuous improvement projects Follow and maintain 6-S/Lean principles of a clean and organized work area and participate in Lean Six Sigma events such as Kaizen, etc. as needed. Generate Statistical Process Control (SPC) graphs as needed, and for quality discussions. The graphs generated will include root cause for trends in data, Out Of Control points (OOC). Make recommendations to plant management for improvement based on data driven decisions. Participates in the Quality discussion as an expert when requested. Conduct self and lab practices in a manner that meets or exceeds Chemtrade guidelines. Be a leader in troubleshooting and daily analytical with the ICP-MS. Other duties as assigned by Management. Ability to adjust to constantly changing analytical demands. Ability to exceed customers’ expectations for quality control. Continuous learning in analytical on the ICP-MS. This may include formal training, training from service engineers, BEST practices shared from other facilities, informal meetings, etc. Other Related Duties: 10% Participate in Responsible CARE activities Participate in RC 14001 Internal and External Audits. Participate in ISO 9001 Internal and External Audits. Participate in customer audits. Facilitate root cause analysis (RCA) investigations using Lean Six Sigma tools (LSS) such as 5-Why, 8D, etc. Updating Laboratory procedures. Construct and update SOP’s, communicate recommendations for changes to Lab Manager. REQUIREMENTS Minimum of an Associate’s degree, Bachelor’s degree preferred in a science or related field. Experience may be substituted. Demonstrate team and leadership skills, a desire to participate in a new business endeavor that is highly competitive, visible, and that requires extremely high quality standards. Experience in instrument calibration, Excellent troubleshooting skills, and good judgment are required. Attention to detail, adaptability, being a self-starter, and good communication skills are essential. Computer skills utilizing Word, Excel, Power Point, SQC software are desirable. WHY JOIN OUR TEAM? Impact, Growth, and Diversity By joining our team, you will have the chance to be part of a vibrant and growing company. As a company that has grown and continues to grow by acquisition, we offer an exciting work atmosphere and opportunities to make a real impact. Our vision to be a Great Chemical Company is supported through our EPIC values (Excellence in Operations, People First, Integrity and Customers) and our commitment to the Health and Safety of our employees, and the communities we work in through Responsible Care®. Our friendly work environment fosters positive interaction between employees within and throughout our 70+ locations. We expect all employees to treat each other with dignity and respect. Safety is at the core of our culture and something that we never compromise on. At Chemtrade, we take pride in rewarding our employees for their commitment, performance and hard work by offering a variety of programs and services. We offer a comprehensive and very competitive health and wellness program, including medical, dental, and a fitness activity subsidy. Our unique culture enables employees to thrive in a supportive and engaging workplace. We offer an exciting rewards program CHEErs! for employee recognition, referrals and milestones. In addition we offer learning and development opportunities through our Chemtrade University. COMPANY OVERVIEW CHEMTRADE is a publically traded (TSX: CHE.UN) chemical manufacturing and handling company serving customers for more than half a century. With over 1.6B in Sales, we pride ourselves on our 4 core strategies of Strategic Growth, Operational Excellence, Financial Prudence and our Diverse Business Model, all while maintaining quality service and a commitment to Responsible Care®. With Headquarters in Toronto, Canada, and operations across North America and Brazil, Chemtrade operates a diversified business providing industrial chemicals and services to our customers in three main business segments; Sulphur & Performance Chemicals, Water Solutions and Electrochemicals. Chemtrade is a reliable industry partners to the Oil & Gas, Pulp & Paper, Water Treatment, Food & Beverage and Pharmaceutical industries. Our success in this global industry is the result of our drive to meet the needs of our customers and is deeply rooted in the talents of our employees and the communities where we operate. Chemtrade is an Equal Opportunity Employer Chemtrade is committed to fair and accessible employment practices and will, where possible, provide accommodations for persons with disabilities. Are you ready to do work that matters? Freedom Forever is literally changing the way the world will use energy in the future. Driven and motivated individuals with a vision to thrive in our fast-paced, high energy environment.say that our company just ranked #135 out of the TOP 500 fastest-growing private companies in America by Inc. 5000!! We are problem solvers, team players, and game-changers! 
 
Freedom Forever is currently hiring for a Solar Production Manager for our Dallas, TX Office! Do you have experience in Residential Solar and looking for a home where you can grow? If you have a passion for Solar, Renewable Energy, Natural Resources, Sustainability, come and apply with us! 
 
Position Summary 
Production Manager reports to the Branch Manager and is responsible for organizing and leading the branch installations team. The Production Manager will be accountable for key performance metrics by managing a team of installers, ensuring that all projects are installed according to company standards. Responsible for scheduling and overseeing the installation of solar projects as well as a smooth handoff between the inspection department. Ensures adherence to contract specifications and established policies and procedures. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Works closely with Branch Coordinator, Project Manager, and Field Manager. 
 
Job Duties/ Responsibilities 
Plan and coordinate installations of photovoltaic (PV) solar systems to ensure conformance to codes and Freedom Forever standards. 
Manage, motivate, and mentor a variety of all personnel involved in the installation of solar projects which may include: Crew Lead(s), Roof Lead (s), and Installer(s). 
Evaluate and manage the resources and processes required for the successful completion of a high volume of residential and small commercial solar projects. 
Drive continuous improvement in Safety, Quality, Customer Service, and Productivity throughout the installation process. 
Ensure that every member of the installation team receives the proper safety training and equipment applicable to their position and follows Standard Operating Procedures for Safety. 
Ensure that “Best Practices” are being consistently applied throughout the install operations. 
Remotely assess potential solar installation sites to determine feasibility and design requirements. 
Assess system performance or functionality at the system, subsystem, and component levels. 
Remotely monitor the work of subcontractors to ensure projects conform to specifications, schedules, or budgets. 
Provide technical assistance to installers, technicians, or other solar professionals in areas such as solar electric systems, solar thermal systems, electrical systems, and mechanical systems. 
Prepare solar installation project proposals, quotes, budgets, or schedules. 
Estimate materials, equipment, and personnel needed for residential or commercial solar installation projects. 
Identify means to reduce costs, minimize risks, or increase the efficiency of solar installation projects. 
Assures the quality of work produced is acceptable to company standards and specifications. 
Work closely with the Branch Manager and the Branch Coordinator to provide accurate installation forecasts and branch performance reporting. 
Work to ensure that we are delivering an excellent customer experience and escalate customer concerns as necessary. 
Follows the safety program established specifically for all installations. 
Manage warehouse facilities as necessary & other duties as assigned. 
 
Qualification Requirements 
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) 
Must have a minimum of 3+ years experience 
Good computer skills with Microsoft Office Suite, experience with Company’s CRM and ERP systems is a plus 
Possess good communication skills that will enhance vendor and supplier relationships, as well as with the installation team 
Possess strong organizational skills and capable of making decisions without constant supervision 
Ability to read and interpret job orders, understands specifications and to read a tape measure 
Possess a wide range of carpentry skills to provide accurate remote job assessment 
Capable of learning new skills as needed 
Have knowledge of materials and processes that relate to the company’s products 
Must have a valid driving license and a clean driving record 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
 
Keywords: Solar, Residential, Production, Install, Solar PV.

NYU Winthrop  is a 591-bed university-affiliated medical center, which offers sophisticated diagnostic and therapeutic care in virtually every specialty and subspecialty of medicine and surgery. We are a major regional healthcare resource with a deep commitment to medical education and research, offering a full complement of inpatient and outpatient services. 
 
Position Summary: 
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Mechanic, HVAC.
 In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for assisting in the year-round operation, maintenance and repair of all HVAC – related mechanical systems required for the continuous and uninterrupted operation of NYU Winthrop Hospital. This includes, but is not limited to Heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration (HVAC-R) systems – (chillers, cooling towers, pumps, packaged rooftop systems, fans, motors, compressors, etc.); temperature control systems (pneumatic and direct-digital control); medical gas systems (supply and distribution); pneumatic tube system; refrigeration equipment and any other system or equipment which falls under the responsibility of the Engineering Department’s HVAC Shop. 
 
Job Responsibilities: 
 
 Able to troubleshoot HVAC and refrigeration related problems and issues and perform the necessary repairs or corrective measures.

General Info 
 
*Our installation mechanics can earn over $30 per hour* 
 
Job Type: Full-Time 
Minimum Years of Experience Required: 5 Years or experience as a lead installer 
Minimum Years of Education Required: High School/GED 
Specialty: Residential 
Must be Authorized to Work in the US 
 
 
Company Info 
 
Our Vision is to be one of the Premier Heating and Air Conditioning companies in our industry focused in the residential and light commercial service and replacement markets. 
 
 It is because of our vision that we have earned a reputation as The Professionals through our 75 years in business, we are a company of honesty and integrity, which has been the essence of our success. We continue to be dedicated to the type of quality workmanship, reliable service, and customer satisfaction that distinguished our company from the beginning. 
 
 Job Description 
 
The HVAC Installation Technician is responsible for accurately installing HVAC equipment in residential and/or commercial structures. Ideal candidates will have knowledge of HVAC equipment, codes, and proper installation procedures.
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Replace any heating, air conditioning, or refrigeration equipment or complete systems 
 Install new duct systems in remodeled rooms or buildings 
 Test electrical circuits and components for continuity, using electrical test equipment 
 Test pipe or tubing joints and connections for leaks, using a pressure gauge or soap-and-water solution
 Join pipes or tubing to the equipment and to the fuel, water, or refrigerant source in order to form a complete circuit
 Lay out and connect electrical wiring between the controls and equipment according to the wiring diagram, using an electrician s hand tools
 Obtain and maintain required certifications 
 Install, connect, and adjust thermostats, humidistats, and timers, using hand tools 
 Comply with all applicable standards, policies, and procedures, including safety procedures and the maintenance of a clean work area 
 Inspect and test systems to verify compliance with plans and specifications and to detect and locate malfunctions 
 
 Duties: 
 
 Knowledge of HVAC codes and proper application; knowledge of proper electrical and HVAC safety 
 Ability to effectively communicate information and respond to questions in person-to-person and small group situations with internal and external customers 
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, customer-focused work environment; ability to balance workload with technicians and customers needs 
 Ability to establish rapport with customers 
 Ability to maintain confidentiality and use discretion with information 
 Ability to read and understand documents such as policy manuals, safety rules, and procedure manuals 
 Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. 
 Must have strong math skills 
 Ability to utilize common-sense understanding in order to carry out written, oral, or diagrammed instructions 
 Ability to take timely action to effectively solve problems, using established policies and procedures 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 5 years of HVAC field experience or experience as a lead installer 
 EPA Certified 
 Valid Georgia driver s license 
 High school diploma or equivalent 
 Successful completion of a certified HVAC installation training program and apprenticeship 
 Ability to explain technical information to non-technical customers 
 
 Benefits 
Medical Insurance 
Dental Insurance 
Vision Insurance 
Life Insurance 
Disability Insurance 
 
401K

REQUIREMENTS: · Prior verifiable experience · Journeyman Electricians with PLC troubleshooting experience. · Industrial Mechanics with CDL A · Industrial Journeyman Millwright/Mechanic experience · Troubleshooting; Palletizers, AC/DC Motors, Engines on Heavy Equipment, Industrial Machines, Conveyer Systems, Diesel Mechanic experience requested but not required. · Able to travel by air to arrive at the client location timely · Welders, TIG, MIG or Stick (Experience in one or all) · Able to mobilize within 24-48 hours to client location · Able to work up to 12 hour days, 7 days per week if necessary · Able to be away from home for the duration of the project · Willing to work any shift including nights, weekends and holidays · Able to work in extreme cold/hot weather conditions · Able to stand, sit, kneel, bend, lift, push, pull for extended periods · Eligible to work in the United States · Agree to complete any required training if necessary · Must have a clean criminal background · Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen For further consideration, please complete our online application at: www.afimacglobal.com. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone. By responding to our Indeed ad, this does not automatically put you in our system. You must complete the online application. WE ARE A DRUG FREE & EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Job Types: Temporary, Contract Salary: $25.00 to $35.00 /hour

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity 
The future is what you make it. 
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.Are you ready to help us make the future? 
 
Job Objectives 
Installs, services, and repairs mechanical equipment at customer sites using hoists, lift trucks, hand tools, and power tools following layout drawings and manufacturer’s instructions, and utilizing mechanical knowledge. Good communication skills and positive attitude. 
 
Position Responsibilities 
This position requires 100% travel 
Performs mechanical functions related to conveyor installation under the direction of a lead or supervisor. Adhering to all safety procedures and policies. 
Ability to lift up to 50lbs, climb ladders and work at heights up to 40ft.
 Ability to stand or walk on concrete or steel grating for an entire shift and willing to work continuous 58-hour work weeks. 
Repairs or replaces worn or defective equipment/machinery. 
 Assists in modifying previously installed equipment/machinery to ensure compatibility with new units. 
 Assists in investigative tests, repairs, and rework of existing equipment. 
 Documents all inspections, maintenance and repair work, and failures. 
Supply own mechanical hand tools per provided list below. Ability to operate industrial power tools that will be supplied. 
 Maintain housekeeping and general clean up duties throughout the site. 
 
Key Responsibilities 
Inspect for Quality 
Install or Repair per Work Order 
Escalate Issues 
WE VALUE 
Mechanical experience 
Some years of experience installing conveyor systems 
Previous industry experience 
Previous technical/installation experience 
Previous customer service experience 
Good written and oral communication 
Ability to follow instructions and identify mistakes 
technical/professional certificate 
Tools That Are 100% Required on Day 1: 
 
Wrench set 3/8”- 1 1/4” 
3/8” Drive socket set 3/8”- 1 1/4” 
3/8” ratchet 
Allen Wrench Set 
Speed Square/Combination Square 
Line up Pin 
Needle nose pliers 
Standard Pliers 
Needle nose vise grips 
2lb. or 3lb, Hammer 
25’ or 30’ tape measure 
12” torpedo level 
Band cutters 
Phillips and flathead screwdrivers 
12” adjustable wrench 
Razor knife 
Chalk box 
Mill File 
Flashlight 
Steel toe safety shoes 
Reliable transportation to customer sites. 
 
PPE and Attire 
Candidates must provide and wear steel toe safety shoes at all times 
Hard Hat (provided by Honeywell) 
Safety Vest (provided by Honeywell) 
Cut resistant gloves (provided by Honeywell) 
Jeans/work pants 
No skirts or shorts 
No overly loose or tight garments 
Long hair tied up at all times while onsite

Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership 
The future is what you make it. 
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.Are you ready to help us make the future? 
 
Job Objectives 
Oversee, direct, coordinate, and be accountable for the mechanical installation project teams. Coordinate project manpower, maintain project budgets, and prepare reports for management. Requires strong communication skills. 
 Position Responsibilities 
This position requires 100% travel 
Accountable for the entire mechanical installation at customer sites related to onsite activities, schedule, and budget. 
Works closely with assigned project manager on customer related issues and schedule requirements and conforms safety for all employees.
 Leads with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within conveyor systems installations. 
Works closely with the Manager and Supporting Manager of installation services on manpower, forecasting, staffing, documenting hours of extra work with explanation (Overrun Alerts), and identifying risks early on.
 Reports via email any inconsistencies in engineered drawings to the lead mechanical engineer and Installation Manager for resolution to avoid delays to the installation process within 24 hours to maintain a sense of urgency. 
Requests and documents all inspections, repair work, and equipment failures 
Attends on site meetings with customer when necessary to coordinate any special situations related to work schedules, badge issues, staging and storage of equipment and tools, break room and restroom usage, and any other issues related to the performance of the mechanical installation with the proper customer representatives. 
Effectively communicates and sets expectations with Mechanical Leads to broadcast directives down to support installers. 
Plays an active role in the hiring and layoff process of local labor coordinating all actions with the Installation Manager and HR representative or Labor Supplier. 
Keeps an updated log of changes made from original layout of system and submits (as builds) Drawings back to engineering for every project.
 Completes and signs check out sheets for entire system to accept responsibility, of work and assure a high level of quality installation. 
Assists engineering commissioners with system run-in, trouble shooting, and rate tests to ensure conveyor rates specifications are met. 
Demonstrates proven knowledge with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within conveyor systems installations. 
Leads with a “hands on” approach to the work. 
Flexible and adaptive with engineering, customer, general contractor, and supporting labor issues. 
Applies mastery of skills and adapts procedures, techniques, tools, materials, and/or equipment, as appropriate to the needs of the project 
Able to perform and teach: 
Read and interpret drawings
 Perform layout using datum lines and other references 
Layout and install ceiling support header/hanger steel efficiently 
Reviews, orders, and installs building air to designated drops per the Engineered drawings 
Installs Platform using most effective methods 
Competent with several types of conveyor product lines 
Maintain housekeeping and general clean up duties throughout the site. 
May be required to serve as a qualifier for various licenses. 
 
YOU MUST HAVE 
8+ years of experience in a leadership role in the conveyor industry.
 Ability to use Microsoft Office programs and Internet Explorer effectively.
 Direct 30+ employees and 4-10 leads on large projects. 
This position requires 100% travel 
WE VALUE 
Previous industry experience 
High school diploma or its equivalent preferred but not required. 
Patience in stressful environments 
Ability to effectively manage tight project schedules 
Experience planning and estimating time for installation-related activities 
Innovative approaches to improving standard processes 
Experience supervising 30+ people directly on any given project 
Excellent communication skills 
Demonstrated ability to operate independently 
Ability to use experience to appropriately apply the established standards 
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage a team
 Previous customer service experience 
Tools That Are 100% Required on Day 1: 
 
Wrench set 3/8”- 1 1/4” 
3/8” Drive socket set 3/8”- 1 1/4” 
3/8” ratchet 
Allen Wrench Set 
Speed Square/Combination Square 
Line up Pin 
Needle nose pliers 
Standard Pliers 
Needle nose vise grips 
2lb. or 3lb, Hammer 
25’ or 30’ tape measure 
12” torpedo level 
Band cutters 
Phillips and flathead screwdrivers 
12” adjustable wrench 
Razor knife 
Chalk box 
Mill File 
Flashlight 
Steel toe safety shoes 
Needs reliable transportation to customer sites.

Candidates must provide and wear steel toe safety shoes at all times 
Hard Hat (provided by Honeywell) 
Safety Vest (provided by Honeywell) 
Cut resistant gloves (provided by Honeywell) 
Jeans/work pants 
No skirts or shorts 
No overly loose or tight garments

Job Summary 
 Please note: This role has a pay progression schedule based years of experience and the acquisition of specific certifications and licenses. This role is also subject to annual contractual increases. 
 
Under supervision, inspects and troubleshoots mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, components and equipment. Maintains, lubricates and repairs mechanical equipment associated with Wastewater Treatment, Collections and Storm/Flood facilities (e.g. heating and ventilation, boilers, chlorinators and combustion fired engines). 
 
 Essential Job Functions 
 Safely uses portable pumps and shop tools to install, repair and maintain mechanical equipment such as pumps, sewage ejectors, air blowers and compressors, boilers and heat exchangers, grinders, heaters, gas meters, mechanical screens, belt and buck conveyors, chlorinators and internal combustion engines. Performs preventive and corrective mechanical work, including carpentry, on projects or systems. Interprets line diagrams, schematics, flow diagrams, blueprints, vendor publications and other documents. Regularly inspects equipment for serviceability. Identifies malfunctions. Changes oils, lubricants, greases and filters for all equipment and machinery, including electric service carts. Handles heavy equipment (frequently over 50 lbs. And occasionally over 100 lbs.) e.g. pump housings, oil drums, and bags of salt (lift from ground to head/shoulder height). Installs mechanical and pneumatic systems. Regularly prepares and maintains records, log books and other data relating to tasks performed. Regularly operates a vehicle as transportation to the job site or for the movement of tools, equipment and materials. Keeps shop, work bench and job sites clean and orderly and performs necessary housekeeping tasks. May perform minor electrical type work to expedite returning a system or equipment to a serviceable condition. Participates in cross-training. Performs other related duties as assigned or as judgment/necessity dictates. 
 
 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Necessary to the Work 
 Knowledge of carpentry, welding, machine shop, electricity, metal fabrication, rigging, medium duty equipment operation, millwright, pipe fitting, blue print reading and mechanical drawing; knowledge of the different types and grades of lubricants; skill in using and operating specialized equipment such as electric welder, gas welding and cutting equipment; ability to use mechanical shop equipment such as drill press, pipe threader, presses, brake press, saws and portable power tools; ability to use machine shop equipment and specialized tools and gauges such as lathes, milling machine, height and depth gauges, vernier calipers, inside and outside micrometers and dial indicators; ability to learn computerized analysis equipment; ability to perform physically demanding tasks as outlined above; ability to work outdoors, at night and under adverse working conditions such as inclement weather; ability to work effectively under heavy, unpredictable surges in workload; ability to work various shifts and mandatory overtime. 
 Minimum Requirements 
 High School Diploma or GED; three or more years of experience working as an industrial maintenance mechanic; an equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted. Must meet job knowledge and job skills assessment requirements. Must possess a valid driver's license. Must have an acceptable and reliable means for being contacted during off-duty hours. Must have safe work and driving habits.

At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water. 
Consider applying here, if you want to: 
Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact. 
Develop lasting relationships with great people. 
Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career. 
We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members. 
Maintenance Technician 
Are you a problem solver who enjoys tinkering with gadgets and equipment? Do you excel in a fast-paced environment where you are empowered to make decisions in a variety of projects? We want to talk to you about our opening for a Maintenance Technician. 
Allow us to introduce ourselves: 
We are a family-owned and operated leading beverage manufacturer in the United States with the fastest production lines in the world. We’re growing rapidly both across the nation and internationally, providing vast opportunities for career advancement. We produce a variety of products including purified water, sparkling water, vitamin-enhanced waters, and sport drinks. While innovation is the key to our success, our tradition of high quality, value-priced bottled water will never change. 
Niagara is a high-performing, entrepreneurial company with focus on safety and continuous improvement. We use advanced, state-of-the art technologies to accomplish our mission of sustainability and responsibly providing quality water to our reputable and internationally recognized customers. Across our maintenance teams, we invest in our equipment and our people, equipping and empowering you and your colleagues to make decisions that drive our continued success. 
What we offer:
 An encouraging and supportive culture where your career growth and development is prioritized 
The ability for you to make a tangible impact in an innovative and fast-paced environment 
Collaboration with other life-long learners who share your curiosity and desire for constant improvement 
Competitive pay and benefits that include: medical, dental, and vision insurance, tuition reimbursement, pet insurance, retirement savings, and of course… refreshing water 
Job Summary: 
The Maintenance Technician ensures all equipment is running smoothly through quick in-depth troubleshooting and repair of all types of manufacturing equipment. No day is the same - your expertise may be called on to fix an urgent issue or you may implement new ideas and modify equipment to improve efficiency. Working as a team with other technicians, machine operators, supervisors, and department managers, the Maintenance Technician will collaborate to resolve mechanical issues. 
What you would be doing as a Maintenance Technician:
 Troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic systems using schematics, technical drawings and testing equipment 
Repair equipment, fixtures, systems, conveyors, and other equipment at facility 
Modify, lubricate, diagnose, and operate equipment 
Maintain industrial control systems 
Work independently and with other team members to complete repairs in a safe and timely manner 
Create and report repairs throughout shift. Complete required work order paperwork, document parts and material usage 
Understand and follow plant safety rules including safe lifting practices and safe machine operation. Personal Protective Equipment is to be used where required 
End each shift knowing you made a difference 
Profile of our Maintenance Technicians: 
Minimum requirements: 
2 years of work experience in a maintenance environment or an Associate’s Degree in a maintenance-related field 
High school diploma or GED 
Basic experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook 
Effective communication of issues and solutions to cross-functional team members 
Ability to read and interpret schematics: electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic 
Skilled in the use of shop equipment such as hydraulic and mechanical presses, bench grinder, drill press, mill and lathe, and assorted power tools 
Proficient skills with precision measuring equipment, such as calipers, dial indicators, bore gauges, and depth gauges 
Willingness to be a technical leader and trainer within a specific area of plant or machine center 
Demonstrated regular and predictable attendance 
Preferred requirements: 
Associate’s Degree in manufacturing, manufacturing technology, mechatronics, industrial manufacturing, manufacturing automation or other similar manufacturing-related specialization 
Experience in high-speed manufacturing, bottling, beverage, packaging, or plastics industries 
Experience with the following technologies: 
Variable frequency drive (VFD), servo drives, and servo motor 
Rotary equipment such as rotary press or filler 
Thermodynamics, heat transfer, or plastics processing 
Krones, Sidel, or Husky equipment 
HVAC including chillers and/or air compressors 
Experience working with electrical, hydraulic and pneumatic schematics for troubleshooting 
Life at Niagara:
 The Maintenance Technician embodies the values of Niagara’s culture, especially focusing in the following key drivers of success: 
Lead Like an Owner:  Do you thrive in overcoming obstacles and with a sense of urgency in achieving objectives? 
InnovACT:  Love making recommendations to continually improve policies, methods, procedures and/or products? 
Find a way:  Like to develop technical knowledge through learning from other experts? 
Empowered to be great:  Enjoy communicating effectively to resolve issues, teach others, and make improvements? 
If this sounds like you, or you are interested in learning more about life at Niagara, please apply and we’ll connect with you soon.

Job Summary:

 Demonstrate root-cause problem solving to identify and perform equipment repairs and improvements 
Work directly with management to develop and execute projects involving continuous improvement, upgrades, and the resolution of reoccurring problems

Utilize skills in fabrication capabilities such as cutting and welding (mig, tig or stick), and work with electrical systems including 480VAC & 24VDC power 
Read and interpret schematics for process and instrumentation diagrams, and repair variable frequency drives, servo motors and controllers, communication systems (asi-bus, can-bus, profi-bus, ethernet), PLC input/output cards, and safety modules

End each shift knowing you made a difference

Skilled in the use of shop equipment such as hydraulic and mechanical presses, bench grinder, drill press, mill and lathe, and assorted power tools 
Proficient skills with precision measuring equipment, such as calipers, dial indicators, bore gauges, and depth gauges 
Willingness to be a technical leader and trainer within a specific area of plant or machine center 
Preferred requirements: 
7 years of work experience in a maintenance manufacturing environment 
Associate’s Degree in manufacturing, manufacturing technology, mechatronics, industrial manufacturing, manufacturing automation or other similar manufacturing-related specialization 
4 years of experience in one of the following fields: blow molding, injection molding, packaging, or beverage 
4 years of experience with Krones, Husky, Sidel, or other packaging or bottling equipment 
1 year of experience leading and developing others on the functionality and repair of equipment 
2 years of experience creating process improvements or continuous improvement initiatives

JOB TITLE: Millwright Journeyman 
BUSINESS UNIT: Titan Contracting and Leasing Co, Inc. 
EMPLOYEE TYPE: Non-Exempt 
REPORTS TO: Foreman 
 
OVERVIEW 
A Journeyman Millwright has a minimum of four (4) years heavy Industrial experience as a Millwright (including helper training) and is proficient in installing, maintaining, repairing, dismantling and moving many types of machinery and equipment, according to layout plans, blue prints and other drawings in industrial settings. 
 
WORK SCHEDULE 
Varies by location. Must have open availability any time, any day of the week. Length of employment is limited to job assignment and/or project duration. 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES 
 Millwright Safety – work safely around the hazards associated with the Millwright field. Millwright Tools – use hand, electric, pneumatic and hydraulic tools in a safe manner. Construction Math - Demonstrates a level of competency in construction math as required in trade practice, including fractions, decimals, geometry, use of formulae, and trigonometry. Construction Drawings – Competently read blue prints and schematic drawings to determine work procedures. Rigging – Safely and competently identify and use, basic and special rigging procedures and equipment including chain hoists, come-alongs, jacks, and tuggers. Must be proficient in the use of hand signals. Can competently inspect common rigging equipment. Fasteners and Anchors – Correctly identify and explain the use of threaded and non-threaded Fasteners, and anchors. Gaskets and O-Rings - Correctly identify various types of gaskets and explain their uses. Layout, cut and install flange gaskets. Competently select and install an O-ring for any given application. Remove and Install Bearings – Correctly identify various types of bearings and be able to remove defective bearings using manual pullers and/or a press. Understand the process of using heat for removing defective bearings. Can identify common bearing failure modes and know the conditions that cause them. Can install pillow block bearings. Setting Base Plates and Sole Plates – Establish base plate and sole plate locations, correctly install base plates and sole plates and be able to field-verify a base plate installation. Packing and Seals – Correctly identify and explain different types of packing and correctly install. Correctly identify and explain types of seals and seal materials. Correctly identify and explain types of mechanical seals and explain mechanical seal classification. Coupling - Correctly identify, explain and install different coupling types. Shims - Correctly identify and explain different types of shim stock and shim materials. Competently fabricate shims. Drives and Blowers – Correctly identify, explain and install different belt drives and chain drives. Identify and have knowledge of types of fans and blowers.
 Equipment - Can correctly identify and explain the use of various conveyors and their components; rotary, reciprocating and centrifugal pumps: and different types of turbines. Utilizes proper methods for storage of motors. Maintenance and Troubleshooting – Can troubleshoot, inspect, install and remove a pump. Correctly identify and explain types of compressors and understand the principles of operation. Correctly identify types of gear boxes and understand how gears operate and identify types of gears. Conventional Alignment - Can explain types of misalignment. Correctly align couplings using the straight edge and feeler gauge method and the dial indicator method. Reverse Alignment – Can explain the conditions that can cause misalignment. Correctly perform reverse dial indicator alignment, using the mathematical equation. Can measure shaft and coupling run out using a dial indicator. Correctly perform reverse dial indicator alignment using a graphical alignment chart. Laser Alignment – Can correctly explain lasers and laser alignment systems. Can effectively operate a laser alignment system. Troubleshoots repeatability and laser problems. Work within precise limits and standards of accuracy. Follow oral and written directions. Work within company policies (including Safety and Human Resources policies), client policy and OSHA safety requirements. Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor as needed. 
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS 
 Four (4) years minimum heavy industrial field experience as a Millwright. Able to identify various types of machinery and understand their working operations. Completion of pre-hire and post-hire substance abuse testing as required by company and/or client. Completion of Safety related certifications such as OSHA 10 or Safety council programs as required by company and/or client. Ability to work with others to achieve job goals. Read, write and communicate using English language sufficient to perform job functions as required by client and/or facility policy. 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS 
 Stand or walk for long periods of time. Use arms and hands to reach for, handle or manipulate objects. Lift and carry materials weighing up to 50 pounds, occasionally lifting items weighing more than 50 pounds with assistance. Climb up and down ladders, scaffolds and other objects. Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl. Acceptable eyesight – naturally or with correction. Eye-hand coordination. Good physical fitness. Good sense of balance. Work at great heights is required.
 
TOOL REQUIREMENTS (minimum) 
 
 25’ Tape Measure Combination Wrenches (3/8”- 1 ¼ “) 50’ Reel –type tape 2 Center Gauges Set thickness Gauges Precision12: Level (Starrett 98 or equal) Plumb Bob 12” Adjustable Wrench 6” Adjustable Wrench 2lb Hammer 2 Cold Chisels (1 ½, 1-1”) 1 dial Indicator and attachments Scribing tool Center Head Protractor Screw Driver( 1 m – flat head , 1 m Phillips head) Tin Snips Hacksaw 2 -2” Micrometers (inside and outside) Allen wrenches ( to 3/8”) 2’ level Torpedo Level (pocket) Socket set ½” drive, 3/8” – 1 1 ¼” 4 Small thin wedges Tool Box with lock Rain coat or Poncho Steel toed or composite toed work boots

 Position Responsibilities

Accountable for the entire mechanical installation at customer sites related to onsite activities, schedule, and budget. 
Works closely with assigned project manager on customer related issues and schedule requirements and conforms safety for all employees.
 Leads with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within conveyor systems installations. 
Works closely with the Manager and Supporting Manager of installation services on manpower, forecasting, staffing, documenting hours of extra work with explanation (Overrun Alerts), and identifying risks early on.

Read and interpret drawings

Competent with several types of conveyor product lines

 Ability to use Microsoft Office programs and Internet Explorer effectively.
 Direct 30+ employees and 4-10 leads on large projects.

 Create custom mechanical CAD components.

 Create components for our 3-D modeling design tool library referencing manufacturer s specification using Solidworks. 
 Use logic, mathematics, reasoning, experimentation, analysis tools, physics, calculus, and written communication skills to analyze and solve complex mechanical designs. 
 Remain current on leading-edge CAD technology, new materials, manufacturing processes and their potential application to our manufacturing facility. 
 Maintain file creation and versioning storage specifications.
 Document all daily actions by completing, maintaining and submitting time logs by project. 
 Research best materials and design approaches for the development of parts/assemblies developed and drafted. 
 Develop part/product renderings.
 Use company standard K factors while creating accurate solid models. 
 Create computer operated machine cutting files. 
 
 Requirement  Qualifications: 
 
 Five (5) Years experience
 Bachelor s Degree Mechanical Engineering 
 Ability to hand sketch 
 Experience with 3-D printing 
 Ability to create CAD drawing of complex assemblies 
 Excellent collaboration skills 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Capable of performing with a sense of urgency and occasionally changing to a project with increased priority.

 SOLIDWORKS 2010 and up

 Experience with Fusion-360 a plus

WE'RE LOOKING FOR 
 Electro Mechanic
 Employment type 
 Regular / Permanent 
 Location 
 
 Wantagh, NEW YORK 
 United States
 Reference Number 
 req18565 
 Who we are? 
With 90,000 people on five continents, SUEZ is a world leader in smart and sustainable resource management. We provide water and waste management solutions that enable cities and industries optimize their resource management and strengthen their environmental and economic performances. 
 
SUEZ in North America operates across all 50 states and Canada with 6,700 employees dedicated to environmental sustainability and smart and sustainable resource management. The company provides drinking water, wastewater and waste collection service to 6.4 million people on a daily basis; treats over 600 million gallons of water and over 450 million gallons of wastewater each day; delivers water treatment and advanced network solutions to 16,000 industrial and municipal sites; processes 55,000 tons of waste for recycling; and rehabilitates and maintains water assets for more than 4,000 municipal and industrial customers. The company is a subsidiary of Paris-based SUEZ.
 Who are we looking for? 
 Education/Equivalent: 
High School diploma or equivalent required 
Work Experience Needed: 
Five (5) years’ experience as an electrician, electronics repair person, or HVAC technician 
Two years of related education at a college, trade school or equivalent may be substituted for experience 
Completion of recognized Apprenticeship program 
 
 What will you be doing? 
 Summary:
 The incumbent is responsible for the maintenance and repair of buildings, wastewater treatment plant equipment and machines and machine tools. The incumbent will possess a working knowledge of electrical and control systems and have reached a high level of competency within a specific trade or discipline (e.g. welding, millwright, mechanics), but will have a functioning ability level in multiple areas. The incumbent will be responsible to guide and train less experienced personnel in areas of expertise. 
 Dimensions:
 No supervisory responsibility 
 Special Skills/Abilities Needed: 
 Knowledge of treatment plant electrical and control systems, machine equipment operations as well as proper procedures for maintenance and repair of such facilities 
Knowledge or/and ability to safely operate electrical test equipment, conduit bender, grinders, nibblers, angle iron cutter, hydraulic press, hoist and other hand or power tools equipment related to the job 
Must be familiar with all safety regulations and be prepared to work in and supervise confined space entry, and LOTO procedures 
Ability to manipulate and understand the required functions of the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) 
Ability to cut with a cutting torch and an arc rod and ability to solder and weld 
Must hold and maintain a valid NYS driver’s license 
 
Nature & Scope-Principal Areas of Responsibilities: 
 Repair and maintain pumps, valves, motors and other process equipment. Perform “cold” electrical connect and disconnects as part of the repair and maintenance functions. Installs electrical conduit and pulls and terminates low voltage wire connections. 
Set up and proficiently operate machine tools to design, make and repair mechanisms and equipment, such as shafts, bushings, sleeves, gears, bearings and other related parts as assigned.
 Fabricate parts and/or install, adjust, dismantle and reassemble machines and plant equipment 
Set up and proficiently operate various tools including, but not limited to: lathes, contour saws, cutoff saws, hand/bench/surface grinders, milling machines, spray welders, gas welders and various hand tools and precision measuring instruments 
Operate and use hoists, lifts, air hammers, masonry drills, grinders, welders and cutting equipment and other power and hand tools to safety accomplish assigned tasks 
Perform welding functions on buildings and equipment in the treatment plant including repair and fabrication work 
Study specifications such as blueprints, electrical schematics, line diagrams, sketches and/or descriptions of parts to be replaced, and plan sequence of operations 
Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of plant equipment as assigned 
Replenish parts and supplies using standard purchasing procedures. Maintain manual and/or computerized work orders and records as directed 
Provide assistance and direction to less experienced Electro mechanics and/or assigned helpers 
Responsible for inspecting and ensuring that all assigned projects completed by direct crews are completed fully and accurately 
May provide support to other skilled trades employees 
Responsible for general housekeeping of maintenance shop, job sites, work areas and other areas as assigned including, but not limited to sweeping, dusting, mapping, cleaning and paining as necessary to maintain areas to Company standards 
Observes all on-the-job safety regulations 
Other related tasks as assigned 
 
Essential Functions: 
 Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
 While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision. 
 Work Conditions  work is performed both inside and outside with exposure to all kinds of weather conditions. Incumbent may be occasionally exposed to some noise, silica, dust, fumes, smoke, gases, greases, oils, electrical energy, solvents and vibration. Incumbent may work on slippery/uneven surfaces, around machinery with moving parts, moving objects/vehicles, ladder/scaffolding, below ground and may be exposed to water or other liquid materials. 
 Maintain a high level of focus on health, safety and environment, ensuring safety within all activities. Work is performed both inside and outside with exposure to all kinds of weather conditions. Incumbent may be occasionally exposed to some noise, silica, dust, fumes, smoke, gases, greases, oils, electrical energy, solvents and vibrations. Incumbent may work on slippery/uneven surfaces, around machinery with moving parts, moving objects/vehicles, and ladder/scaffolding, below ground and may be exposed to water and other liquid materials. 
 We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

Job Description: 
Position Overview: 
 The primary responsibility of this position is to maintain and monitor mechanical and computerized converting equipment in a continuous production environment. Focus on optimizing the process, balancing line flow, improving equipment uptime, and maintaining a preventative maintenance program on all equipment. 
 Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities: 
 Perform routine service, setup, adjustment of tissue converting equipment: wrappers, winders, folders, casepackers, etc. 
 Repair and maintain all the production machinery 
 Anticipate/Request needed equipment, parts, and supplies 
 Remove and replace defective parts 
 Identify, plan, and execute mechanical maintenance tasks 
 Troubleshoot and locate source of problem by observing mechanical devices in operation 
 Communicate, train, and work with operators and the maintenance dept to ensure optimal efficiency 
 Participate in machine down days and machine trials 
 Complete assigned work orders; enter work orders and data into the computerized maintenance systems; share data and information to other team members 
 Inform production workers of routine preventive maintenance techniques and monitor compliance 
 Set up new product recipes and adjust existing settings and functional parts of equipment and control instruments 
 Train other employees on equipment components and systems 
 Maintain safe and clean work environment by adhering to company policy, rules and regulations 
 Contribute to team effort. 
 Skills / Requirements: 
Basic Qualifications : 
 Must be legally permitted to work in the United States 
 Must be able to read, write and speak English 
 Must be self-directed, highly motivated, safety conscious and team oriented 
 Must have a high school diploma or GED 
 Must have 2+ years of prior experience in maintenance and troubleshooting experience in a manufacturing environment 
 Tissue Converting experience a plus 
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivated, adaptable and have a positive attitude 
 Be able to work 12 hour shift, some weekends, days and nights 
 Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus 
 Must be willing to cross train in other maintenance disciplines 
 Must have experience in preventive and predictive techniques. 
 
Working Conditions - Essential Physical Requirements: 
 Must be able to work in and around extreme temperatures 
 Must be able to bend, squat, kneel, climb, twist and reach above shoulder level 
 Must be able to tolerate hot, dusty, humid, noisy mill environment 
 Must be able to lift 50lbs. 
 
Equal Opportunity Employer

ABC PM, LLC, a leading service and repair business, is a highly successful Service Company specializing in the motor and pump industry. ABC PM, LLC ,  a PumpMan Company  is currently seeking a skilled Mechanic/Machinist to join the team.
 Our employees are offered a great work environment, professional career development, competitive compensation customized training programs, a competitive salary and benefit programs. 
 
If you are a person that can think logically and enjoys learning and growing in knowledge, solving problems, coupled with the necessary manual machinist knowledge, skills and abilities, then our team is interested in speaking with you. 
 
We are currently seeking a pump and/or electric motor machinist with experience in machining, repairing rotating equipment, including centrifugal pumps and positive displacement pumps with submersible motors and non-submersible motors. Position entails day-to-day troubleshooting and repair of electric motors and pumps; mechanical seal replacement; and bearing replacement in motors, pumps, and blowers. 
 
Required Qualifications: 
 
 Must have experience in the maintenance and repair of pumps and or electric motors, pump motors, including submersibles. 
 Ability to analyze pump and motor equipment failures to determine cause and to prevent recurrences. 
 Study blueprints, layouts or charts, and job orders for information on specifications and tooling instructions, and to determine material requirements and operational sequences. 
 Adjust machine controls and change tool settings to keep dimensions within specified tolerances. 
 Move controls to set cutting speeds and depths and feed rates, and to position tools in relation to work pieces. 
 Start lathe or turning machines and observe operations to ensure that specifications are met. 
 Select cutting tools and tooling instructions, according to written specifications or knowledge of metal properties and shop mathematics. Crank machines through cycles, stopping to adjust tool positions and machine controls to ensure specified timing, clearances, and tolerances. 
 Lift metal stock or work pieces manually or using hoists, and position and secure them in machines, using fasteners and hand tools. 
 Replace worn tools, and sharpen dull cutting tools and dies using bench grinders or cutter-grinding machines. 
 Position, secure, and align cutting tools in tool-holders on machines, using hand tools, and verify their positions with measuring instruments. 
 When not operating lathe or mill, assist others with assembly and disassembly of electric motors, preform supervised shop maintenance and cleaning, and any other shop tasks given by supervisors. 
 Safely use hand, air, and electric tools. Follow all shop safety rules. 
 
 Essential Functions: 
 
 Must be able to disassemble and reassemble various types of rotating equipment. (Pumps, Centrifugal, Submersible, Vertical, Turbine, Gear Reducers, Electric Motors and blowers.) 
 Knowledge of tolerances for bearing fit and clearances, motor connections and testing. 
 Knowledge of operating lifting equipment such as forklifts, hoists and cranes. 
 Comply with all safety policies, practices, and procedures; report all unsafe activity. 
 Participate in team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals. 
 The ideal candidate will have at least 4 years of Manual Machining experience. 
 Experience in welding, self starter and self-reliant and excellent problem solving skills 
 Must have a valid driver s license 
 High School or Trade School Diploma 
 Minimum 2-3 years Electrical & Plumbing background. 
 Ability to diagnose problems and determine appropriate action. 
 Read, interpret, and work from sketches, books, blueprints, and specifications. 
 The employee must lift and/or move more than 25-50 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. 
 Must always have a valid driver s license. 
 Candidates must pass pre-employment background and drug test 
 
 Technical Skills: 
 
 Troubleshoot & repair electrical & electronic malfunctions 
 Single & 3 phase AC motor & controls 
 VFD installation, set up and troubleshooting 
 Control panel wiring 
 Troubleshooting analog sensors, photo electric, inductive, capacitive, transducer 
 Electronics components testing for capacitors, diode, transistor & SCR 
 Run conduit, inspect & repair circuits and wiring, repair & rewire according to building codes & safety regulations 
 Plan, layout, measure, cut and install plumbing, pipe & tubing 
 AC/DC drives 
 
 Compensation/Benefits: 
 
 Competitive Hourly Rate 
 Medical, Dental, Vision 
 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan 
 Paid Time Off and Holidays 
 Uniforms provided
