SunBlue Energy, Westchester, NY 
 
SunBlue Energy designs and installs solar energy systems for homes and businesses in and around Westchester County. We are dedicated to quality work and are looking to grow our team with reliable, adept solar installers who are comfortable with roof work and come to work with enthusiasm for completing the job at hand. 
 
Position : 
 
This position is for a solar technician who can perform all tasks needed to complete a photovoltaic system installation. 
 
Responsibilities : 
 
 Pulling inventory for each installation job 
 Pre-assemble job components in the warehouse 
 Layout and assembly of solar modules / array and mounting hardware 
 Mechanical/structural mounting of racking, modules and electrical equipment 
 Electrical wiring of solar array/system (AC and DC) 
 Document completion of completed installation 
 Clean up of job site 
 Attend mandatory training sessions on new products, installation methodology and safety 
 Additional duties required as needed 
 
 Qualifications : 
 
 Highly conscientious about quality of work 
 2 years of roofing, construction or solar energy installation required 
 Ability to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, etc) 
 Must be willing and able to climb ladders, stairs, work on rooftops and able to work on your feet for long periods of time 
 Previous solar experience strongly preferred 
 Basic computer skills including familiarity with Microsoft Office programs 
 Must have a valid driver’s license 
 Reliable transportation to and from job sites 
 Strong communication skills 
 
 To join our team, please send your resume and cover letter to jobs@sunblueenergy.com, with “Solar Technician application” in the email’s title. 
 We offer: 
 
 Competitive compensation 
 Paid vacation and holidays 
 Health insurance 
 Continuing education opportunities

develop and utilize Safety Inspection Worksheet Inspect crew tools and equipment, ensuring proper safe operation and usage Participate and/or lead “Critique” in the event of mishap, injury or “near-miss” REQUIRED (BASIC) QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS  10+ years of experience as an electrical mechanic performing residential and commercial work Demonstrated experience as On Site Manager for commercial projects, managing crews and interacting with customers Demonstrated experience properly managing projects from start to finish: Job costing, materials lists, costs tracking, timeline management, assigning and managing labor, commissioning, troubleshooting, etc. Ability to read and interpret drawings, schematics and specifications Command knowledge of National Electric Code, capable of recalling all common electrical regulations and calculations quickly Command knowledge of OSHA and other safe rules and regulations; Responsibilities: 
This is a contract/consultant position, at a part-time equivalency, for the Westchester County, NY area. Residential Solar QA Inspector performs quality assurance inspection services and reporting of residential solar system installations to ensure compliance with product manufacturers’ installation instructions, building/electrical/mechanical/plumbing codes and standards, and industry best practices. 
A person in this position is expected to demonstrate 
(a) Expertise in quality assurance systems, preferably with a strong knowledge of Photovoltaic (PV) technologies and installation practices; 
(b) Knowledge as to the application of corresponding building, electrical, and fire codes; 
(c) Professionalism in customer relations with all levels of clients and coworkers; 
(d) Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of stakeholders; and the 
(e) Ability to successfully complete projects on time and within budget. 
 
A person in this position will be expected to complete the following 
Schedule and perform Solar QA inspections as assigned by IBTS 
Ensure that inspections are performed within turnaround times as determined by IBTS. 
Perform quality assurance inspections/audits of residential and commercial solar system installations. 
Inspect properties and materials for compliance with plans, specifications, and manufacturers’ requirements. 
Document the audit with a full photo taken to illustrate all findings on-site, and provide descriptions of any issues which have noted deficiencies and require corrective action. Complete applicable inspection forms and submit along with photos within 3 days of inspection completion. 
Maintain data on residential PV products, installation instructions, test methods, and other documents as deemed appropriate for the work. Must stay continually educated in solar product changes and code requirements. 
Participate in monthly calls as provided or directed by IBTS. 
Obtain and maintain certifications, licenses, and insurance required for work as an independent contractor in your region. 
REQUIRED CERTIFICATION 
NABCEP Certified PV Installer, OR UL PV Installer Certification 
PREFERRED LICENSE OR CERTIFICATION 
International Code Council (ICC) certification as a Residential Electrical Inspector 
License as a General / Electrical Contractor or license/certification as a solar system installer 
IBEW Journeyman, OR Professional Engineer, OR Licensed Electrician. OR a combination of NABCEP Associate Certification and Journeyman. 
Qualifications: 
REQUIRED 
Must have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle transportation 
Excellent organizational skills and attention to details 
Own and be able to operate with efficiency and ease: cell phone, digital camera, and computer with internet access (preferably PC) 
Able to communicate effectively and professionally with homeowners, business owners, PV installation contractors, and IBTS management team 
Own and be able to operate basic tool set including ladder, electrical PPE, measuring tape, compass, inclinometer, flashlight, and screw drivers with basic bit set of Philips, flat, T-25, T-28 Torx, and Allen wrench set 
Maintain any relevant certifications and/or licenses that are required by your local jurisdiction for carrying out assigned tasks
 PREFERRED 
Extensive knowledge of applicable codes, standards, and trade practices 
Working knowledge of reading plans, specifications, and product manufacturers’ installation instructions 
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS 
 
REQUIRED 
High school diploma or GED
 Basic entry level coursework in solar photovoltaics or minimum 6 months experience in the solar electrical industry or related construction employment 
OSHA 10-hour certification training 
PREFERRED 
Combined 3 years or more experience in design or installation of electrical systems and/or inspection of residential electrical or solar electrical systems 
Extensive knowledge of applicable codes, standards, and trade practices 
Working knowledge of reading plans, specifications, and product manufacturers’ installation instructions 
3 years’ experience in Solar PV installation, design, or inspection services
 PREFERRED LICENSE OR CERTIFICATION 
International Code Council (ICC) certification as a Residential Electrical Inspector 
License as a General / Electrical Contractor or license/certification as a solar system installer 
NABCEP Certified PV Installer, OR IBEW Journeyman, OR UL PV Installer Certification, OR Professional Engineer, OR Licensed Electrician. OR a combination of NABCEP Associate Certification and Journeyman. 
Physical Demands: 
Most of the work will be performed in the field on residential construction jobsites; roof access will be required. 
Some work in the office will also be required and as such the following working conditions apply: 
Position requires sitting, standing, walking on un-level and slippery surfaces including pitched roofs, climbing ladders, accessing confined spaces such as attics and crawl spaces, reaching, twisting, turning, kneeling, bending, stooping, squatting, crouching, grasping, crawling and making repetitive hand movements in the performance of daily activities. 
Significant local travel on daily inspection routes anticipated. 
Overview: 
Bring your passion, expertise, and experience to IBTS! 
 
The Institute for Building Technology and Safety (IBTS) is a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization that was established to provide unbiased professional building code compliance services, while enhancing the communities in which we work. At IBTS, our mission is to deliver quality services to meet the challenges of governance at all levels while enhancing public safety, economic development, and the general welfare of the community. Our services include Building and Community Development, Energy and Sustainability Services, Disaster Planning and Recovery, Quality Assurance, as well as Compliance and Risk Monitoring. 
 
IBTS is headquartered in Ashburn, VA, with additional offices in Louisiana, Missouri, New York, Oklahoma, Texas and Washington, DC. 
 
We are committed to building a community of experts with diverse backgrounds, disciplines, and perspectives who are passionate about our mission. IBTS is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. S3 Residence, disability, and veterans encouraged to apply.

Job Description  The Solar Installer will be responsible for assembling and installing solar photovoltaic (PV) modules to roofs, or other structures, in compliance with site assessment and schematics. Roles & Responsibilities  Installation of solar modules to code and specifications. Identify safety hazards, proper orientation, module layout, solar access and structural integrity. Examine designs to determine current requirements; Identify and resolve any deficiencies in system installation or materials. Maintain thorough documentation of system installation including photographs, location diagrams for arrays and equipment, and existing site features. Submit all documentation in a timely manner. Maintain a neat and orderly job site. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications & Experience  High school diploma or GED. 1-2 years of electrical training or experience is preferred. Good mechanical skill set, such as: working with hands, tools, climbing, good sense of balance, bending, kneeling, crouching, etc. Work safely on roofs for extended periods of time; ascend and descend ladders. Regularly lift and move up to 40 to 50 lbs. Must have regular, reliable attendance record. Arrange own transportation to office or job site (as specified by your supervisor). Benefits  Health, Dental and Vision Plans 401K with Company Matching Company Sponsored Life Insurance Paid Time-Off and Paid Holidays Full Time/Year-Round Work About Trinity Solar  Founded in 1994, Trinity has grown into the largest privately held residential solar installation company in the nation - employing more than 1,800 people and operating in communities across NJ, NY, CT, MA, PA, MD, RI and DE. Solar Thermal / PV Installer / Field Technician – Palm Beach/Broward/Miami-Dade Counties area in South Florida :  Cross Atlantic Solar  is currently seeking an experienced installation Technician to join our solar Installation Team. This position is to service areas throughout the Palm Beach/Broward & Miami-Dade counties area. The position requires ability and willingness to operate on all different height, and types of roofs. General tradesmanship etiquette including work vehicle cleanliness and organization. Personal tools and PPE required. Required skill set:  * Minimum of 1- 3 years’ experience in solar thermal and or PV installations (or related work experience). * * Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in electrical application installations/service (or related work experience). * * Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in plumbing installation/service (or related work experience). * * Demonstrated knowledge of OSHA safety and compliance * * Demonstrated knowledge of construction work application and code compliance * * Good knowledge of customer quality standards to include; job site etiquette, professionalism. * * Installation and termination of DC power and grounding equipment and cabling. * * Highly motivated, able to work in a fast paced environment. * * Strong analytical / problem solving and troubleshooting skills. * * Effective time management and strategic planning skills. * * Excellent verbal and written communication skills and needs to be well organized. * * Must be able to work 40 hours (or more) per week, including overtime if required. * * Must be able to comprehend and communicate technical documentation, specifications and product Data Sheets. * * Able to work at heights up to 40 feet (if necessary). * * Able to climb ladders of various heights, if necessary. * * High School or equivalent diploma. * * Must have reliable transportation. * * Must have valid driver’s license (endorsements a plus to include CDL). * * Must have personal hand-tools, and power tools to perform equipment installations. * * Able to pass drug and background check. * * * Job Responsibilities:  Installation and commissioning of various solar equipment and products including Photovoltaic system components, and Thermal solar systems. Perform various roof application procedures including "tie off" protocols. Commissioning of PV system components and communication equipment. Perform troubleshooting, splicing and analyzing of high voltage DC circuits. Ensure safety, quality, customer experience, communication and on time delivery. Work with a sense of urgency, be adaptable to change, and eager to learn new technologies. Follow Lead Technicians instructions for the entire duration of multiple-site projects and inspections. Terminate various types of cabling to include, but not limited to; twisted pair copper, coaxial, power DC+AC, fiber, CAT5/CAT6, RJ6 cabling. Work in all types of environments to include but not limited to; indoors, outdoors, rooftops, customer premises. Pay:  Pay based on level of experience  Cross Atlantic Solar LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer as defined by the EEOC and a Drug Free Workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, Job Type: Full-time Salary: $40,000.00 to $60,000.00 /year Experience: Solar Thermal: 1 year (Preferred) Plumbing: 1 year (Preferred) Solar PV: 1 year (Required) Electrical: 1 year (Preferred) Education: High school or equivalent (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required) Work Location: Multiple locations Typical start time: 7AM Typical end time: 5PM Pay Frequency: Bi weekly or Twice monthly This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction Schedule: Monday to Friday Company's website: www.crossatlanticsolar.com Work Remotely: No

Description: 
SunLux Energy is an established residential solar company that is rapidly growing and expanding, we are looking for solar Installers to join our team. Applicant must have previous experience in residential solar installations.
 Applicant will report to Crew Lead and Superintendent. Candidate will Install photovoltaic (PV) systems in accordance with local codes and standards using drawings, schematics, and assemble solar modules, panels, or support structures, as specified.
 Applicant must have strong work ethic, positive attitude, and be a team player.
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Install solar arrays per plan set, measure to plan. 
 Layout and assembly of solar modules / array and mounting hardware 
 Apply weather sealing to roofing structure, building or support mechanisms 
 Mechanical/structural mounting of racking, modules and electrical equipment 
 Electrical wiring of solar array/system (DC and AC) 
 Knowledge of SolarEdge is required. 
 Must be familiar with all roofing systems, composition Shingle, flat, and Tile roofs. 
 Document completion of completed installation 
 Ensure a clean and orderly job site 
 Communicate the necessary job status to SunLux operations management team to assure the successful operation of complete and working systems 
 Participate in mandatory training sessions on new products, installation methodology and safety. 
 Install Seal and flash the solar mounts to ensure penetrations are water tight. 
 Must have experience installing on comp shingle, tile, Flat and metal roofs. 
 Install solar Racking and solar panels. 
 Experience installing SolarEdge optimizers and Enphase Micro Inverters. 
 Has all the tools required to complete the job. 
 Must be able to climb ladders, stairs, and work from heights 
 Must be able to work on feet for extended period of time 
 Basic understanding of electrical wiring 
 Must be a team player. 
 Can bend ¾ inch conduit at a basic level. 
 Must be able to carry, push and pull up to 50 + Lbs. 
 Listens and takes direction from Roof Lead and Crew Foreman. 
 Attention to detail is a must and Takes pride in their work and finished product. 
 Experience- Minimum 1 years as a solar installer. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 1 year of roof work, general construction, or carpentry strongly preferred 
 Must be able to lift 50 lbs up to 100 lbs at times 
 Ability to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, etc.) 
 Must be willing and able to climb ladders, stairs, work on rooftops and able to work on your feet for long periods of time 
 High school diploma or GED required 
 Regular, reliable and predictable attendance required 
 Ability to work well with others in a collaborative team environment 
 Must have a valid state driver’s license 
 Must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment criminal, driving and drug screen 
 
All applicants are evaluated based on bona fide job criteria; consistent also with applicable state and federal laws without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, religious belief, national origin, marital status, veteran status, medical condition and mental or physical disability. This company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and holds the rights of all individuals as valuable.
 Job Type:  Full-time
 Salary:  $16.00-20.00/hr DOE

Role and Responsibilities The Solar Installation Technician will be responsible for the successful installation of solar photovoltaic systems. The tech will have knowledge of different racking systems, how to install on various roof surfaces, and how to wire the DC portions of a system. Techs will be responsible reading and fully understanding design drawings, acquiring the necessary parts from the warehouse or off site vendor, and transporting equipment to the job site. Tech will be expected to work safely in all weather conditions and be prepared for both extreme cold and warm temperatures. Techs will be responsible for helping to create a safe work environment and abide by JMB’s code of safety. This person will have the skills necessary to install solar modules, run conduit, pull wire, and terminate connections. A technician will also be expected to perform quality checks as well as commission completed work and troubleshoot any errors. Qualifications and Education Requirements Experience with Zep Racking System prefered 1-year experience working on rooftop solar projects Experience with reading design documents and electrical drawings Experience with module layout, roof and module attachments 1-year experience bending conduit up to 1” 1-year experience pulling and terminating wire on both the DC and AC side of the inverter Ability to work safely at heights and carry up to 60 lbs Applicants should be in good physical shape with no lifting restrictions, have common hand tools, have reliable transportation to and from work and be comfortable using ladders and working on roofs. Construction and/or PV experience is a plus. Operating power tools, saws, drills, ladder lifts and light duty equipment, Preferred Skills: Conduit bending Electrical Troubleshooting Design and drawing comprehension Knowledge of general safety best practices Job Type: Full-time Salary: $29.00 to $35.00 /hour Experience: Construction or Roofing: 1 year (Preferred) Zep Solar Racking: 1 year (Preferred) Rooftop Solar: 1 year (Preferred) Pulling and Terminating Wire: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insurance Dental insurance Vision insurance Paid time off Pay Frequency: Weekly This Job Is: A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to apply Schedule: Monday to Friday Day shift

Solar Installer 
Job Description 
 
A Solar installer will be working with a team to install solar Photovoltaics onto residential and commercial buildings. You will work with a team up to 4 to install roof attachments, seal roof penetrations, install racking, some wiring and set roof panels. 
 RESPONSIBLILITES: 
Install roof mounted solar panels 
Comply with jobsite safety programs 
Complete installation on various roof types in timely manner 
Report to crew lead and work in concert with 3-4 other workers on a jobsite 
Follow instructions of crew foreman/lead 
Job clean up at end of day 
Ensure high quality and best practices used throughout installation 
 
QUALIFICATIONS: 
Minimum 1 year experience 
Valid driver's license 
Personal hand tools and cordless drills (18V or equivalent) 
Be able to lift 50lbs regularly throughout the day 
Comfortable with heights 
Be able to interact professionally with customers 
Read and understand blueprints and schematics 
Mental toughness to complete installations on schedule 
Pay begins at these tiers: 
Experienced solar installer or lead: $17-24/hr 
Benefits:
 Raises are based on work performance and overall knowledge of solar installation. Training and/or experience in the solar field is a plus, Electrical and Roofing are preferred fields of experience. 
Job Type: Full-time 
 
Benefits include: 100% paid medical, dental and vision plan, 100% paid life insurance, 401k, paid holidays, sick time and paid vacation.

Company Information  Established in 1989, Solare Energy (www.SolareEnergy.com) is one of the largest installers of solar and battery systems in San Diego County. We have unmatched contracting experience in the design and installation of solar photovoltaic (PV) systems, Tesla Powerwall home battery systems, and energy efficiency systems. We are a high growth organization and are looking for high potential individuals to grow together with the company Position Description  The position is for a Digital Marketing Coordinator that will be responsible for the design, implementation, and management of all digital marketing activities to create brand awareness and generate leads. The Digital Marketing Coordinator will focus primarily on generating leads to sell solar PV and battery systems to residential and commercial customers. Responsibilities  Build brand awareness and generate leads to sell solar PV systems to residential and commercial customers Implement the digital marketing plan with corresponding budget Coordinate with the President and the VP of Sales on all digital marketing activities Design and manage online marketing efforts (e.g., search engine optimization, search engine ad words, banner ads) Design and execute monthly communications with existing customer and lead database Manage social media accounts, maintaining a high engagement level with customers and followers Generate periodic marketing reports, including customer acquisition cost by marketing source Candidate Qualifications and Attributes  Required (please do not apply if you don’t meet these requirements):  Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field At least 1 years of experience in digital marketing to consumers Experience designing, developing, and maintaining websites that run on WordPress platform Experience running Google AdWords marketing (Pay Per Click or PPC) Experience creating artwork and copy for marketing materials/campaigns Experience managing social media and email marketing campaigns Proficiency with design software (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Microsoft Publisher), customer relationship software (e.g., SalesForce.com, Zoho), and Google Analytics. Desired But Not Required:  Experience in marketing solar and energy efficiency systems: solar PV, solar hot water, solar pool heating, lighting, HVAC, pool pumps, skylights, insulation, weatherization, etc. Experience in marketing home improvement products and services Attributes:  Energetic, proactive, professional, creative, resourceful, strong quantitative skills, personable, competitive. Instructions  Will only consider local candidates. Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume Job Type: Full-time Salary: $42,000.00 /year Experience: Digital Marketing: 1 year (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: San Diego, CA 92126 (Required) Application Question: Are you available to start work immediately? Additional Compensation: Bonuses Work Location: One location Benefits: Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Company's website: https://solareenergy.com/ Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/SolareEnergy/ Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

About Empire Solar Group 
 
Empire Solar is a group of eager and driven solar enthusiasts looking to make a wave in the industry. Offering a partner-network model with national reach. Quality, Integrity, and Total Customer Satisfaction are our top priorities. Residential and commercial Solar PV Systems. Rooftop, Ground mount, photovoltaic materials, EPC fulfillment, Array Design, and more. We have grown exponentially over the last year and are in search of an  Junior Solar Installer in Minneapolis  who will become a strong contributor and make a difference. 
 
 About this Opportunity 
If you are interested in starting an opportunity that is the fastest growing career in the United States this opportunity is for you! We are hiring for an entry level solar installer; we will teach you all the best practices you need to grow in this field and you will join an organization that is committed to you success. 
 
 Key Responsibilities 
 Prepare customer's homes for solar systems. 
 Assemble and install solar systems. 
 Test installed systems for desired performance. 
 Install roof and ground mounts. 
 Proper layout, assembly, and installation of systems 
 Documentation of completed jobs 
 Carpentry tasks as needed 
 Safety training and additional install training as needed 
 Ensure a safe work environment through safe work practices for the entire installation team 
 Be able to lift 50 pounds. 
 Be comfortable climbing ladders. 
 Be comfortable using PPE while working on customer roofs. 
 
 Experience 
 Experience in other trades such as roofing, construction, or electrical strongly desired 
 1 Years of excellent customer service experience. 
 Ability to prioritize and resolve multiple issues on multiple projects under demanding schedule constraints. 
 Strong verbal/written communication skills 
 Able to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment 
 
 Compensation 
 W2 full time 
 Competitive Compensation based on experience paid weekly 
 Competitive PTO and Holiday schedule (Including your birthday!) 
 401K and Matching 
 Defined, merit-based career path. 
 Medical Dental and Vision Benefits

Empire Solar Group is an equal employment opportunity to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, we comply with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location that we facilitate. Are you ready to do work that matters? Freedom Forever is literally changing the way the world will use energy in the future. Driven and motivated individuals with a vision to thrive in our fast-paced, high energy environment.say that our company just ranked #135 out of the TOP 500 fastest-growing private companies in America by Inc. 5000!! We are problem solvers, team players, and game-changers! 
 
Freedom Forever is currently hiring for a Solar Production Manager for our Dallas, TX Office! Do you have experience in Residential Solar and looking for a home where you can grow? If you have a passion for Solar, Renewable Energy, Natural Resources, Sustainability, come and apply with us! 
 
Position Summary 
Production Manager reports to the Branch Manager and is responsible for organizing and leading the branch installations team. The Production Manager will be accountable for key performance metrics by managing a team of installers, ensuring that all projects are installed according to company standards. Responsible for scheduling and overseeing the installation of solar projects as well as a smooth handoff between the inspection department. Ensures adherence to contract specifications and established policies and procedures. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Works closely with Branch Coordinator, Project Manager, and Field Manager. 
 
Job Duties/ Responsibilities 
Plan and coordinate installations of photovoltaic (PV) solar systems to ensure conformance to codes and Freedom Forever standards. 
Manage, motivate, and mentor a variety of all personnel involved in the installation of solar projects which may include: Crew Lead(s), Roof Lead (s), and Installer(s). 
Evaluate and manage the resources and processes required for the successful completion of a high volume of residential and small commercial solar projects. 
Drive continuous improvement in Safety, Quality, Customer Service, and Productivity throughout the installation process. 
Ensure that every member of the installation team receives the proper safety training and equipment applicable to their position and follows Standard Operating Procedures for Safety. 
Ensure that “Best Practices” are being consistently applied throughout the install operations. 
Remotely assess potential solar installation sites to determine feasibility and design requirements. 
Assess system performance or functionality at the system, subsystem, and component levels. 
Remotely monitor the work of subcontractors to ensure projects conform to specifications, schedules, or budgets. 
Provide technical assistance to installers, technicians, or other solar professionals in areas such as solar electric systems, solar thermal systems, electrical systems, and mechanical systems. 
Prepare solar installation project proposals, quotes, budgets, or schedules. 
Estimate materials, equipment, and personnel needed for residential or commercial solar installation projects. 
Identify means to reduce costs, minimize risks, or increase the efficiency of solar installation projects. 
Assures the quality of work produced is acceptable to company standards and specifications. 
Work closely with the Branch Manager and the Branch Coordinator to provide accurate installation forecasts and branch performance reporting. 
Work to ensure that we are delivering an excellent customer experience and escalate customer concerns as necessary. 
Follows the safety program established specifically for all installations. 
Manage warehouse facilities as necessary & other duties as assigned. 
 
Qualification Requirements 
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) 
Must have a minimum of 3+ years experience 
Good computer skills with Microsoft Office Suite, experience with Company’s CRM and ERP systems is a plus 
Possess good communication skills that will enhance vendor and supplier relationships, as well as with the installation team 
Possess strong organizational skills and capable of making decisions without constant supervision 
Ability to read and interpret job orders, understands specifications and to read a tape measure 
Possess a wide range of carpentry skills to provide accurate remote job assessment 
Capable of learning new skills as needed 
Have knowledge of materials and processes that relate to the company’s products 
Must have a valid driving license and a clean driving record 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
 
Keywords: Solar, Residential, Production, Install, Solar PV.

Momentum Solar  is a premier residential solar provider with offices throughout the U.S. Founded in 2009, Momentum has grown exponentially over the past decade. We implement the entire solar process to ensure a seamless transition to renewable energy. 
Overview 
The Solar Installation technician will assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems via ground mounts in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks. 
 
Responsibilities 
Pre-assemble and load job components for the project. 
Assembly of solar modules/array and mounting hardware. 
Mechanical/structural mounting of racking, modules and electrical equipment. 
Electrical wiring of solar array/system (AC and DC). 
Attend training sessions on new products, installation methodology, and safety. 
Requirements 
Knowledge of hand-held power tools. 
Previous experience in PV installations, roof work, general construction, or carpentry preferred. 
Basic understanding/experience with electrical wiring of AC and DC systems preferred. 
Heavy Machinery operation preferred. 
Solar experience preferred but not required. 
Momentum Solar is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

Introduction: 
Sunrun is the nation’s leading home solar, battery storage, and energy services company. Our mission is to confront our planet’s biggest challenge, climate change, by creating a planet run by the sun. This mission requires passion, determination and a diverse growing army of talented professionals. Explore joining our mission by connecting with Sunrun's Talent Network or submitting an application to this job today. 
Overview:The Electrical Foreman will provide leadership and technical expertise for a solar installation crew. The Electrical Foreman is responsible for the Safety, Quality, Customer Service, and Productivity of each assigned solar installation project. The Electrical Foreman is a working field position that leads a team of 3 to 6 members to successfully complete residential and small commercial projects.Responsibilities: 
Responsible for the successful installation of residential solar projects 
Organize, lead, and train crew members to complete projects within established guidelines and timeframes 
Ensure attention to detail with an emphasis on safety, quality, customer service, and productivity
 Effectively manage all aspects of the construction workflow of the project to drive productivity 
Ensure that there is adequate materials and equipment to safely and efficiently complete projects; 
Effectively maintain project documentation and photo requirements 
Demonstrate knowledge of OSHA standards related to photovoltaic installations and enforce safety practices and standards 
Check on progress of installers every hour throughout the installation to ensure the installation process; Follow Construction Job Flow Procedures
 Develop a positive working dynamic within installation crew and branch co-workers; Analyze and resolve worker problems and recommend solutions; Maintain consistent and appropriate interface with customer throughout construction phase 
Perform weekly vehicle inspection for proper tire pressures, oil level, working lights, etc. 
Obtain customer payments and deliver to management as required
 Ensure accuracy of your own and crew's time sheets
 Provide construct-ability feedback to management
 Maintain excellent lines of communication
 Perform service calls when necessary 
Additional duties assigned as needed 
Qualifications: 
Must possess a valid Journeyman License/Electrician Certification or equivalent per local and state requirements, e.g. wireman license
 Knowledge of the NEC and applicable codes and standards. Carry and maintain up-to-date NEC code book 
Ability to perform all installation duties of the Installer and Lead Installer 
Have CPR and First Aid Certifications up to date and keep maintained for purposes of continued employment (class costs are reimbursable by the company) 
Physically capable of performing work duties 
Professional appearance and customer interaction 
Have a strong work ethic, high level of craftsmanship/workmanship with strong attention to detail 
Basic computer knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word 
Possess strong mechanical/construction skills 
Have excellent verbal communication and documentation skills 
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously 
Have good people skills, able to manage, motivate and discipline when necessary 
Experience with electrical work involving wiring up to 600 VDC and 480 VAC
 Maintain a valid Driver’s License 
5% travel required 
 
PHYSICAL  DEMANDS 
Ability to transport materials and equipment to complete assigned job tasks (up to 50 pounds frequently and up to 100 pounds with assistance) 
Ability to work on rooftops with various angles and surfaces which requires frequent bending, twisting, squatting, climbing, kneeling, crawling, turning, standing, and balance 
Ability to work in confined spaces such as attics, basements, and crawl spaces which requires kneeling and crouching 
Ability to work in outdoor weather conditions including but not limited to: excessive noise, extreme heat, extreme cold, wet environment, and humidity 
Ability to frequently utilize hand functions requiring fine motor skills including but not limited to: fine manipulation, grasping, and pinching 
Ability to work within the safe range of equipment such as ladders, fall protection harnesses and other personal protective equipment 
Ability to work while wearing heavy protective equipment such as arc flash suits, gloves, and face shields 
Ability to work and maintain balance on roofs and other areas of height 
Ability to work in the sun and possibly low light conditions 
Ability to walk on rafters, roof tiles, and roof shingles without damage 
Ability to distinguish colors such as red, black, yellow, white, green 
Ability to hear verbal commands and warnings 
Ability to work with chemicals using appropriate protection

We need experienced installers looking for a long term position and willing to grow their career. Candidate must have experience & be knowledgeable in DSC, Ademco, GE & Honeywell systems and experienced in pre-wiring or retrofitting all perimeter devices. Must be knowledgeable in CCTV installs and network configuration. Must have a clean background & driving record. Also if you are a licensed fire technician, and / or are knowledgeable with A/V work, computer networking or access control that is a PLUS. Benefits & pay based on experience. 
 
 Job Type : Full-time 
 
Experience:  relevant: 3 years (Preferred) Installation: 3 years (Preferred) 
 
Work Location:  Multiple locations in and around the Middle TN Area. Occasional overnight travel required.
 Benefits:  Paid time off, Holidays, 401K, Health Insurance, Dental, Vision, LIfe, company vehicle
 Pay Frequency:  weekly via direct deposit 
 
 Essential Duties & Functions: 
 
Drill holes for wiring in wall studs, joists, ceilings, floors, and other areas as required.
 Examine systems to locate problems such as loose connections or broken insulation.
 Feed cables through access holes, roof spaces, and cavity walls to reach fixture outlets, then position and terminate cables, wires and strapping.
 Inspect installation sites and study work orders, building plans, and installation manuals in order to determine materials requirements and installation procedures have been met.
 Install, maintain, or repair security systems, alarm devices, and related equipment, following blueprints of electrical layouts and building plans.
 Mount and fasten control panels, door and window contacts, sensors, and video cameras, and attach electrical and telephone wiring in order to connect components.
 Mount raceways and conduits, and fasten wires to wood framing, using staplers.
 Test and repair circuits and sensors, following wiring and system specifications.
 Test backup batteries, keypad programming, sirens, and all security features in order to ensure proper functioning, and to diagnose malfunctions.
 Keep informed of new products and developments.
 Request orders for replacement parts.
 Performs a variety of marginal duties not listed, to be determined and assigned as needed. 
 
 Physical Requirements: 
 
Remaining in a standing or kneeling position for extended periods of time.
 Have Tolerance to heat and cold.
 Ascend or descend ladder or stairs multiple times a day.
 Lift up to 50 lbs. 
 
 Other Requirements:
 Industry Experience required.
 High School Diploma or equivalent.
 State Security License Preferred (or ability to attain).
 Valid Drivers License.
 U.S Citizen or have authorization to work in the U.S as defined by the Immigration Act of 1986.
 Possess a clean criminal and driving record, ability to pass a background check and drug screening.

What you will do 
 
The primary function of this position is to manage the Electronic Fire Alarm and Security delivery process, maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction while maximizing operational efficiencies, controlling costs within the district and meeting corporate financial goals. This position will manage project engineering, project management, order entry, installation and technical installation support. 
 
 How you will do it 
 
• Customer Satisfaction: Coordinate with sales to analyze customer requirements and contractual obligations, determining the best possible Johnson Controls, Inc. application. Responsible for executing the best solution for total customer satisfaction. This includes maintaining effective two-way communication with the customer from the initial order point to the warranty period. 
 Fiscal Responsibility: Responsible for providing the highest quality delivery at the lowest possible cost. Responsible for operating within an approved financial plan, which includes direct costs, indirect costs, accounts receivable and profitability. Operational Responsibility: Oversee the support activity associated with the submittal process, engineering, technical support, installation schematics, equipment delivery, outside purchasing, scheduling, labor planning and business issues, such as, bonds ,insurance and approvals. Interface with service department to ensure seamless project turnover. Installation Responsibility: Manage all installation requirements including material purchasing, project scheduling, with fiscal responsibility, installing through SimplexGrinnell installer or subcontractor management in accordance with company policy in a cost efficient manner. Manage the technical installation support activity including programming and operating systems according to customer specifications and applicable code requirements. Productivity Improvement: Ensure that effective performance measurements are assigned and employees are motivated to achieve and exceed objectives in a professional, timely and quality manner. Coordinate with and support the sales representatives in order to better serve the customer, grow the business and ultimately increase the sales volume per sales representative. Personnel Management: Empower, organize, and develop local installation staff into a cohesive and effective team trained and motivated to grow the business. Responsible for hiring quality individuals who possess the necessary skills, knowledge, talent, and experience to fill open job positions. Identify areas such as sales skills, business and product knowledge, and customer service, where training and development can enhance the district's abilities to meet current and future business needs. Maintain an open channel of communications among all departments and personnel to ensure consistent dialogue, foster initiative, and maintain employee morale. Safety Compliance: Ensure that all employees comply with corporate safety programs and that employee safety training is complete and up-to-date. Completes all workplace accident investigations as required by the company's EH&S policy. Identify safety issues and hazards and notify the corporate safety officer of conditions that require corrective action. Legal Compliance: Abide by Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, as well as all Company policies and procedures. Perform other duties as directed. 
 What we look for 
 
 Preferred 
 
• Minimum (7) seven years’ experience in management of district operation activities and fire sprinkler industry experience. 
 Electronic Fire Alarm and Security Operations Leadership experience preferred. Previous P&L management experience a plus. Associates degree, preferably in a business or engineering discipline. 
 
 Required 
 
• Ability to read and comprehend financial statements. 
 Ability to read and negotiate terms for standard construction contracts. Previous P&L management experience a plus. High school diploma or equivalent Must obtain and retain NICET Level II Certification or higher within first 12 months. Requires good interpersonal skills, along with effective writing, speaking and presentation skills. 
Demonstrated management/leadership abilities to include training, team building, presentation and negotiation skills, branch administration and effective interaction with customer/company management. 
 Knowledge of applicable local, state and federal codes required. Proficient with MS Office as well as online systems.

Job Description 
 SECURITY ALARM TECHNICIAN 
 Interface Security Systems is the one provider who can do it all, safely integrating network and security needs into one highly reliable and cost-effective bundle. With private monitored and managed broadband, video monitoring, security & life safety, digital voice, and new business intelligence capabilities, we’re uniquely equipped to meet the rapidly-changing technology demands of today’s retail, commercial and small business enterprises. Our services include providing evaluation, engineering, installation and maintenance of the active and passive components that comprise: Fire systems, VoIP Systems, TCP/IP Networks, CCTV, Security, Access Control, Intrusion, and Wireless Solutions. 
 Commercial Alarm- Install -Service 
 POSITION SUMMARY 
 In this position, you will perform surveys and assist in troubleshooting and maintaining Fire Systems, Burglar Alarms, VoIP Systems, TCP/IP Networks, CCTV Security, Access Control & Wireless solutions. As a Security Alarm Technician, you will be responsible for installing and servicing, key & PBX systems, security & CCTV systems, wireless devices, and cable pathway. This will also include installing various electronic components and cables to involve terminating, testing, labeling and documenting horizontal, backbone & other cables. Furthermore, 
 Specific duties for this  Security Alarm Technician  role include, but are not limited to: 
 Install and repair fire and burglar alarm systems, both commercial and residential. 
 Work directly in the field on the most efficient way to solve service issues. 
 Request off-site service equipment needs through internal Service Dispatch department. 
 Customer training as needed. 
 Maintain acceptable and accurate inventory levels by conducting physical inventory counts. 
 Verify and submit all documentation for inventoried items as per the company policy. 
 Install twisted pair cable, coax, power limited tray cable, stranded cable, solid conductor low voltage cable, single mode fiber optical cable and multi-mode fiber optical cable. 
 Replace, service, and perform new wiring installs, UPS battery tests, network cable runs. 
 Dress and route cable into telecoms closets, modular furniture & other work area outlets. 
 Firestopping various types of cable penetrations. 
 Understand, adhere to, and promote the Environmental and Health & Safety policies of AFL Telecoms. 
 Interface with customer contacts on projects and work orders. 
 Interface with the end-user and coordinate with vendors for each project. 
 Hands-on field interaction with customers at the site level and some smaller customer care levels. 
 The position is full time and includes rotating 24/7 on-call duties . 
 Job Requirements 
 We are looking for a self-driven and customer-focused experienced Field Technician who combines excellent leadership and problem-solving skills, with a strong mechanical and technical aptitude to exceed customers’ expectations. You should be highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously within a highly technical and fast-paced environment. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, plus the ability to maintain and portray a positive attitude committed to consistently performing high-quality work. 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
 High School Diploma or GED; Vocational/Technical/Business School, strongly preferred. 
 Valid driver’s license. 
 Verifiable field experience. 
 Ability to read Blue Prints. 
 Solid comprehension of the terminology pertaining to the installation & service of telecom, data, security & wireless systems. 
 Solid Comprehension of the publications pertaining to standard telecom, data, security & wireless systems practices, engineering & Federal, State & local safety standards. 
 Computer proficiency including Microsoft Office Suite. 
 Ability to pass applicable state & federal background checks in order to become a registered security installer. 
 Comfortable using small hand tools and power tools. 
 Legally authorized to work in the United States of America. 
 Physical demands include:
 Finger & wrist dexterity & hand/eye coordination. 
 Heavy physical effort. 
 Climbing stairs, ladders, and/or scaffolds. 
 Ability to work from heights such as man lifts, scissor lifts & roof tops utilizing proper fall protection. 
 Carrying loads up and down stairs. 
 Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions. 
 Exposure to noisy or dusty conditions; chemicals & solvents; mechanical, electrical, and/or other hazards. 
 Schedule flexibility and willingness to travel overnight 
 Commercial Alarm Technician – Install -Service 
 Interface Security Services—Simplify to the power of one.

 Ensure DynaFire is never the reason that the certificate of occupancy does not pass the first time. 
 Programming of the fire alarm system and any other systems on a project. PM can assign the programming to another person or department, but the PM is ultimately responsible. 
 Design of the fire alarm system and any other systems on a project, which means the PM must approve or reject a project coming from sales. Each project requires a meeting with the sales representative at the time of hand-off from sales to operations. 
 Secure and maintain Tech Handbook assigned for each project. 
 Effectively communicate the needs required to complete DynaFire's scope of work to all parties impacting the project. This includes DynaFire foreman, installers, clients, and client's clients. 
 Promptly communicates with the client any issues related to the project. 
 Responsible for the mobilization, wiring, trimming, final connections, programming, pretesting, trouble shooting, final testing, and providing final documentation to complete the delivery of a system. 
 Assist sales in writing RFI's and change orders. 
 The ability to effectively hand and computer program fire alarm panels. This includes updating and maintaining all necessary licenses required to program systems. 
 Guiding and instructing DynaFire personnel on the proper application of product to comply with all applicable industry codes and standards, including local jurisdiction requirements. 
 Assist Engineering department in creating accurate documentation when called upon. 
 Attend project meetings when needed by sales or client. 
 Trains and instructs the installation workforce and peers as needed. 
 Trains and instructs client on the proper use of the equipment. 
 Responsible for reading and interpreting wiring diagrams, schematics, shop and contract drawings, and specifications. 
 Must be able to operate Volt and Ohm meter, oscilloscope, multimeter, tone generator, and batter tester. 
 Responsible for maintaining and delivering specialty construction tools for the project foreman. 
 Acquire and maintain required tools on the tool list. 
 Responsible for tracking labor, material, equipment, punch lists, and RFI's. 
 Full compliance with DynaFire's and client's safety programs. 
 Providing necessary reports as needed by management. 
 Have a working knowledge of construction tools, including lifts and wire pulling devices. 
 Acquire, install, and program DynaNet radios as needed for projects. Also requires providing all the necessary information to the DynaNet Network Manager to create an account. 
 Qualifications: 
 Obtain NICET Level II within 12 months. 
 Obtain NICET Level III within 24 months. 
 Obtain NICET Level IV within 36 months. 
 Obtain and maintain all Notifier Onyx Series certifications within 18 months. 
 Participate in required DynaFire sponsored training. 
 Learn and implement the five project management process groups.

Job Description 
 SECURITY ALARM TECHNICIAN 
 Interface Security Systems is the one provider who can do it all, safely integrating network and security needs into one highly reliable and cost-effective bundle. With private monitored and managed broadband, video monitoring, security & life safety, digital voice, and new business intelligence capabilities, we’re uniquely equipped to meet the rapidly-changing technology demands of today’s retail, commercial and small business enterprises. Our services include providing evaluation, engineering, installation and maintenance of the active and passive components that comprise: Fire systems, VoIP Systems, TCP/IP Networks, CCTV, Security, Access Control, Intrusion, and Wireless Solutions. 
 Commercial Alarm- Install -Service 
 POSITION SUMMARY 
 In this position, you will perform surveys and assist in troubleshooting and maintaining Fire Systems, Burglar Alarms, VoIP Systems, TCP/IP Networks, CCTV Security, Access Control & Wireless solutions. As a Security Alarm Technician, you will be responsible for installing and servicing, key & PBX systems, security & CCTV systems, wireless devices, and cable pathway. This will also include installing various electronic components and cables to involve terminating, testing, labeling and documenting horizontal, backbone & other cables. Furthermore, 
 Specific duties for this  Security Alarm Technician  role include, but are not limited to: 
 Install and repair fire and burglar alarm systems, both commercial and residential. 
 Work directly in the field on the most efficient way to solve service issues. 
 Request off-site service equipment needs through internal Service Dispatch department. 
 Customer training as needed. 
 Maintain acceptable and accurate inventory levels by conducting physical inventory counts. 
 Verify and submit all documentation for inventoried items as per the company policy. 
 Install twisted pair cable, coax, power limited tray cable, stranded cable, solid conductor low voltage cable, single mode fiber optical cable and multi-mode fiber optical cable. 
 Replace, service, and perform new wiring installs, UPS battery tests, network cable runs. 
 Dress and route cable into telecoms closets, modular furniture & other work area outlets. 
 Firestopping various types of cable penetrations. 
 Understand, adhere to, and promote the Environmental and Health & Safety policies of AFL Telecoms. 
 Interface with customer contacts on projects and work orders. 
 Interface with the end-user and coordinate with vendors for each project. 
 Hands-on field interaction with customers at the site level and some smaller customer care levels. 
 The position is full time and includes rotating 24/7 on-call duties . 
 Job Requirements 
 We are looking for a self-driven and customer-focused experienced Field Technician who combines excellent leadership and problem-solving skills, with a strong mechanical and technical aptitude to exceed customers’ expectations. You should be highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously within a highly technical and fast-paced environment. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, plus the ability to maintain and portray a positive attitude committed to consistently performing high-quality work. 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
 High School Diploma or GED; Vocational/Technical/Business School, strongly preferred. 
 Valid driver’s license. 
 NICET CERTIFICATION IS A PREFERRED. 
 Verifiable field experience. 
 Ability to read Blue Prints. 
 Solid comprehension of the terminology pertaining to the installation & service of telecom, data, security & wireless systems. 
 Solid Comprehension of the publications pertaining to standard telecom, data, security & wireless systems practices, engineering & Federal, State & local safety standards. 
 Computer proficiency including Microsoft Office Suite. 
 Ability to pass applicable state & federal background checks in order to become a registered security installer. 
 Comfortable using small hand tools and power tools. 
 Legally authorized to work in the United States of America. 
 Physical demands include:
 Finger & wrist dexterity & hand/eye coordination. 
 Heavy physical effort. 
 Climbing stairs, ladders, and/or scaffolds. 
 Ability to work from heights such as man lifts, scissor lifts & roof tops utilizing proper fall protection. 
 Carrying loads up and down stairs. 
 Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions. 
 Exposure to noisy or dusty conditions; chemicals & solvents; mechanical, electrical, and/or other hazards. 
 Schedule flexibility and willingness to travel overnight 
 Commercial Alarm Technician – Install -Service 
 Interface Security Services—Simplify to the power of one.

 Excellent communication skills both verbal and written 
 Proficient in MS Office Suite, MSM, other sales software

 Effectively implement problem resolution 
 Base salary, auto allowance, commission

SENIOR TECHNICIAN  JOB DESCRIPTION  Position Title: Senior (Sr.) Service Technician Date Revised: January 1, 2017  FLSA Status: Non-Exempt Reports To: Location dependent – Service Manager, or  Operations Manager  Schedule: Shift – approximately 8-10 hours per day primarily between the hours of 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with 1 hour lunch break unless arrangements have been agreed to by the employer and the employee; Usually 5 days/week, 40-50 hours/week. On Call service will be required.  The on call schedule requires 24 hour, after normal business hours, availability to service clients for a full seven (7) days.  This schedule rotates among local technicians. Please refer to employee handbook for details. JOB SUMMARY : The primary responsibility of the Service Technician is to service existing system hardware, software, field devices, and associated wiring to the highest industry and Knight Security Systems (KSS) standards. Service Technician is responsible for system training, inspections, correcting or adjusting system programming, or other malfunctions in systems such as intrusion, access control, video, intercom, fire, integration programming, etc. Service Technician is accountable for communication with the customer, vendors, subcontractors, and Knight Security Systems’ personnel. The Service Technician will ensure that all Knight Security Systems’ process and procedures are followed. Service Technician may be responsible for field supervision of KSS employees, subcontractors, and on site coordination between other trades. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :  Possess knowledge of all field devices provided, professional wiring methods, programming, system capabilities, and competent in all installation aspects.  Join in scheduled on-call rotation and satisfactorily service clients  Coordinate schedule with Knight service personnel  Coordinate and document activities with other installation/construction trades  Know and understand the system requirements and deliver the agreed service to the client  Have a comprehensive understanding of Fire Alarm installation and codes.  Demonstrate capability to use a computer to program IP addresses of devices, panels, routers, servers, etc.  Perform complex system programming on intrusion, access, video, other systems, and system integration.  Use the proper trouble solving methods for field wiring, device repair/application, and system programming.  Document as-built changes of system installation  Properly record daily time and task electronically per KSS process.  Communicate daily progress to the project supervisor in format required.  Possess ability to understand project blueprints and service accordingly.  Define and sequence all service activities to achieve daily schedule.  Know and follow all KSS, OSHA, and jobsite safety requirements.  Attend any required meetings. Page | 1  Attend weekly Operations Department meetings to communicate and identify issues and provide detailed suggested solutions.  Maintain electronic and hard copy job folders, and Company systems, to include all necessary information such as Bill of Materials, Work Schedule, Asset Sheets, Approved Plans, Permits, and Packing Slips for received materials, contractor bids, and Scope of Work.  Monitor and control KSS costs related to the execution of system servicing.  Continually coordinate with any involved trades and document any Knight Security requirements to meet and exceed customer expectations.  Cost 70+% of labor time to service tickets while maintaining high efficiency and productivity  Adhere to all Knight Security Systems’ policies and procedures.  Keep track of all KSS project equipment and materials.  Keep customer site and company vehicle clean, organized, and orderly.  May supervisor others at times.  Other duties as assigned.  Ensure you constantly operate within the Knight Security Core Values of  Honor,   Integrity, Service. OTHER DUTIES :  Constantly work towards your development of industry and product knowledge.  Attend any on-going safety meetings. MENTAL DEMANDS :  Most of the duties are varied and regularly require analysis, comprehension or limited judgment and discretion. Some of the duties may not conform to standard practices requiring the use of the analysis and interpretation to resolve problems.  Requires the use of mathematical skills occasionally or about 1/3 of the time.  Requires continuous concentration, alertness and attention to detail.  Requires an astute and comprehensive level of reading and writing.  Requires the capability to work in stressful situations. PHYSICAL DEMAND CLASSIFICATION : MEDIUM (Occasionally requires lifting objects up to 50 pounds) PHYSICAL AND COMMUNICATION DEMANDS :  Constant (67-100%): grasping, handling, responding to written or verbal requests of co-workers and clients, and vision.  Frequent (34-66%): standing, walking, hearing, written communications to clients, talking on the telephone, talking to co-workers and clients, and receiving verbal and written instructions.  Occasional (1-33%): sitting, supervising others, lifting ground to waist height up to 50#, carrying (10 to 15 feet) up to 50#, twisting, bending, kneeling, forward reaching, and eye-hand-foot coordination. DESCRIPTION OF TASKS : Pushing/Pulling/Lifting/Carrying:  Occasional pushing/pulling/lifting/carrying is required when the employee is moving files, boxes, office supplies, materials, equipment, or demo gear. Force pounds were estimated to be 25-50#. Sitting:  The employee may spend time sitting at a work station or desk. Page | 2 Standing/Walking:  Alternate standing and walking is performed often when employee is walking within office or customer site. Climbing/Bending/Stooping/Crouching/Squatting/Kneeling:  These techniques can be used by the employee when performing lifting, carrying, or with position tolerance tasks. Climbing is performed when the employee needs to climb a ladder for installation or service of wire and devices, onto a step stool to reach items on shelves, or during jobsite evaluation visits. Forward torso bending, stooping and crouching may be preference of the worker when reaching or material handling at lowered work surfaces, assembling equipment, and/or reaching for items on the ground or lower shelves. This position has regular verbal and written contact with clients, Technicians, Installers, middle and senior management. The nature of communications required range from a routine exchange of information to a process of securing information and/or responding to inquiries where explanation and discussion may be required using judgment. REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE:   High School Diploma and at least 5 years of related technician experience or a commensurate combination of education and experience.  Must possess or be able to pass a state required background test and hold a Texas Security License.  Pass mandatory drug tests.  Acceptable Plotkin Test Score.  Acceptable Position Assessment Score (70%+)  Clean and satisfactory driving record, safely operate motor vehicle.  Must hold and possess proficiency in a total of 3 of the following Industry Credentials.  Must hold and possess proficiency in a total of 8 of the following Product Certifications.   Bolded  Certifications and Credentials are mandatory of the total requirement listed above. Industry Credentials  Texas State Fire Alarm License  NICET II Fire Alarm Certification NICET IV Fire Alarm Certification Texas State Fire Alarm Planner NBFAA Level I NBFAA Level II OSHA Certification  Homeland Security TWIC Card CFATS Certification CAD Level I Autodesk User CAD Level II Autodesk Pro CompTia Certification A+ Certification CompTia Security+ Certification CompTia Linux+ Certification Physical Security Professional Electronic Security Assoc. NTS Certified Security Project Manager (PSP) Certified System Integrator (CSPM) Certified Project Manager Registered Communications VB Script Professional (PMP) Distribution Designer (RCDD) CCENT CCDA CCNA Microsoft MCSE: Server Microsoft MCSA Microsoft MCSE: Data Platform Infrastructure Product Certifications  DMP Technical  Bosch Alarm Certification Genetec Synergys  (Access)  Genetec Omnicast  (Video) Genetec Enterprise Genetec Advanced  S2 Basic  S2 Advanced Milestone Advanced  Milestone Expert OnSSI 5.x Video Insight Exacq Brivo / Eagle Eye Edwards Vigilant Easy Lobby Active Directory Silent Knight  Sony, IQInvision, Panasonic,  Commend, Aiphone, or 2N Helios Page | 3 Axis, or Samsung   Ability to follow instructions.  Engineering and Technology — Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.  Computers and Electronics — Knowledge of electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.  Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment — Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing devices and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic principles.  Customer and Personal Service — Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.  Critical Thinking — Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.  Installation — Installing equipment, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.  Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment — Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing devices and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic principles.  Updating and Using Relevant Knowledge — Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.  Inspecting Equipment, Structures, or Material — Inspecting equipment, structures, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects.  Dependability — Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations.  Attention to Detail — Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks.  Independence — Job requires guiding oneself with little or no supervision and depending on oneself to get things done. EQUIPMENT, MACHINES, TOOLS USED:  Motor vehicle, computer, computer software, scanner, printer, telephone, copier, calculator, and hand truck. May use other equipment as required for the position. DESCRIPTION OF WORK ENVIRONMENT:  Environmental Exposure: Inside: 50% Outside: 50% Temperature: Inside usually heated / air conditioned Work is performed indoors and outdoors. Employee may be in contact with chemicals (i.e., toner for copier), and materials (i.e., paper) normally found at offices. Employee may also be exposed to noise and vibration. Vision and Hearing: Must be able to clearly see the computer monitor with or without corrected vision. Must be able to judge or distinguish distance and space relationships. Must be able to hear within a normal range with or without a hearing device. Security Installation Technician
 Summary:  The Security Installation technician will be primarily responsible for performing high quality Alarm system installations for residential and small businesses customers, while maintaining a high level of professionalism in face-to-face customer interactions and create a daily atmosphere of suggestive upselling and provide an excellent customer experience.
 
 Essential Duties/Responsibilities: 
 
 Follow installation processes that meet all NFPA70 and NFPA72 standards. 
 Perform Security and Home Automation installations in residential and small business environments 
 Execute Daily work schedule while maintaining a high on time rate 
 Correct utilization and inspection of PPE equipment 
 Follow all Safety Protocols that relate to daily work activities 
 Maintain adequate stock levels for daily jobs and conduct weekly inventory audits with 0 shrinkage 
 Execution of Service manager work orders and proper utilization of the time, mileage and job status tracking software. 
 Complete Electronic Contracts with Customers while maintaining 100% data entry accuracy 
 Maintain KPI’s such as on time rate, avg install time, Tech CSAT scores 
 Perform Service for existing security customers as needed. 
 
 Physical requirements: 
Since our schedule is open 6 days a week we require availability for early evenings and Saturdays. Ability to move up and down ladders with max height of 10ft alone and higher with a safety spotter, ability to move through attics in hot and cold conditions.
 
 Additional Requirements/Skills: 
 
 Texas Private Security Registration Alarm Systems Installer License required 
 At Least a Residential Fire Alarm License (FAL) (RAS Preferred) 
 Minimal 2 years of Residential alarm experience required 
 2 gig and Alarm.com experience (Preferred) 
 Strong multi-tasking and time management skills 
 1+ Years of Sale experience 
 Strong customer service skills 
 Strong problem solving skills 
 Strong Communication Skills written and verbal 
 Available to work 6 days a week during peak season 
 You must have your own Truck Or SUV 
 Must have your own tools. 
 
 Education:  High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s degree in a business or related area from an accredited four-year university is preferred.

TradeSTAR is seeking experienced Fire Alarm Technicians /Installers for an established Fire Protection organization in the North Texas market. Company has been in business over 25 years, has an established footprint across Texas and is looking to add to their core team. Job site location will be through out the DFW Metroplex.
 Responsibilities 
 
 Perform installation, programming, service, testing, troubleshooting, and repair on fire alarm and/or special hazards suppression systems. 
 
 Install Fire Alarm devices such as: strobes, horns, smoke detectors, CO2 detectors, duct detectors, pull stations, emergency phones, tamper and flow switches, elevator recall, mass notification, beam detectors, etc. 
 
 Install and program fire alarm panels is a plus. 
 
 Read and interpret blueprints, diagrams, submittals, specifications, software/systems programs, schematics, and operational product manuals. 
 
 Qualifications and Skills 
 
 One or more years of experience in Fire Alarm, Special Systems, Nurse Call, and/or Mass Notification installation and service  is preferred . 
 
 Ability to troubleshoot effectively and think on your feet. 
 
 Excellent communication skills both written and oral. 
 
 Ability to pass a criminal background check. 
 
 Valid driver license. 
 
 TradeSTAR Benefits: 
 
 Health Benefits 
 
 401K 
 
 Paid Holidays 
 
 Compensation dependent on experience 
 
 For immediate consideration, Call 469-930-7515 or send resume to dalfire@tradestarinc.com
 Additional job responsibilities:
 Install, program, maintain, or repair security or fire alarm wiring and equipment. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes.
 Examine systems to locate problems, such as loose connections or broken insulation.
 Mount and fasten control panels, door and window contacts, sensors, or video cameras and attach electrical and telephone wiring to connect components.
 Install, maintain, or repair security systems, alarm devices, or related equipment, following blueprints of electrical layouts and building plans.
 Inspect installation sites and study work orders, building plans, and installation manuals to determine materials requirements and installation procedures.
 Adjust sensitivity of units, based on room structures and manufacturers' recommendations, using programming keypads.
 Test and repair circuits and sensors, following wiring and system specifications.
 Drill holes for wiring in wall studs, joists, ceilings, or floors
 Demonstrate systems for customers and explain details, such as the causes and consequences of false alarms.
 Consult with clients to assess risks and to determine security requirements.
 Keep informed of new products and developments.
 Mount raceways and conduits and fasten wires to wood framing, using staplers
 Provide customers with cost estimates for equipment installation.
 Prepare documents, such as invoices or warranties.
 Order replacement parts.
 Feed cables through access holes, roof spaces, or cavity walls to reach fixture outlets, positioning and terminating cables, wires, or strapping.
 Test backup batteries, keypad programming, sirens, or other security features to ensure proper functioning or to diagnose malfunctions.
